chunks.translated_text:
Within it lies the profoundest of mysteries—
beyond this truth, no truth remains.
Gather your provisions, seal them fast,
so that one day your success may be stamped upon the heart.

Let it be stamped upon the heart—
seek the fifty-two verses well.
Should false words be spoken, Heaven’s judgment falls;
to speak of this to the unworthy invites the lash and loss of life!

**Song of Refining Lead**
Who understands the art of refining lead?
Attain this, and you become a true immortal.
I grieved in old age, finding no trace,
wandering the Five Lakes and Three Isles.
At sixty-seven, I entered Zhongnan,
where I met a true adept and received the supreme treasure.
True lead arises before Heaven and Earth—
what need is there for metals, stones, or herbs?
Refine it through the nine nines, and when the work is done,
gold treasures bloom within the crucible.
A single golden bone shakes Heaven and Earth;
the harmony of two eights gives birth to a radiant form.
Once the radiant form emerges within the earthen cauldron,
you must guard it with unwavering mindfulness.
When the first yang fire rises, nurture it gently;
when the second yang fire rises, divine power manifests.
Should it reach the third yang of the *Tai* hexagram,
a roaring blaze consumes the empty sky.
The yin tally retreats, giving rise to the numinous essence—
once the numinous essence is born, Heaven and Earth are complete.
If any deficiency remains, harmonize again,
return it to the earthen cauldron to regenerate the numinous essence.
When the full count of five thousand four hundred is reached,
the true marvel of refining lead is perfected.
I charge you, later kindred spirits:
do not regard refining lead as an easy task.

**Song of the Primordial Qi**
Born as a child of the primordial,
hidden within the mountain of form, hard to encounter.
I speak plainly—remember this well:
a single string of spring water encompasses the terrain.
Draw it in through the lower gate, swallow it whole—
the twelve thunder gates tremble in awe.
Drunk, oh drunk, ever more drunk,
the cinnabar field blooms with spring, red as jade.
Feasting on peaches, savoring the fragrance of aged wine,
the *xun* wind stirs the primordial harmonious qi.
Yin demons are vanquished, spring fills the breast;
gods wail, ghosts shriek, the heavens and earth overturn.
When merit is complete and the work fulfilled to three thousand,
mount the phoenix, ride the crane, and ascend as an immortal.

**Song of Lead and Fire**
The great elixir arises at its appointed time—
at the *hai* hour, the beginning of *zi*, the fifth watch of night.
Spirit and essence unite in radiant splendor,
vaguely, indistinctly, a bright moon is born.
After union, it flows downward in a bubbling surge—
the first yang returns; do not let it slip away.
Hasten to seal the Great Mystery’s gate,
fire drives the elixir past the *weilu* cavity.
At the moment of gathering, fix your gaze on the *niwan*;
lower the left, then raise it, pausing to rest.
This is called "gazing upward to ascend the mystery";
then lower the right, raise it again, and bend.
When the six sixes are complete, the elixir is born in *qian*;
yang at its peak gives way to yin, shifting to the right.
Open the gate to withdraw the fire,
your gaze descends to guard the *kun* field.
Right up, left down—once fixed,
the two eights complete a celestial cycle.
This is the natural rhythm of true firing—
spontaneous ascent and descent, white draws and replenishes.

chunks.original_text: 也无弦望与晦朔，也无沐浴共长篇。 异名扫除譬喻扫，只斯两句是真诠。 了道歌 神不外游精不泄。 气不耗散灵芽植。 五行四象入中宫，何虑金丹不自结。 内有真神外有应，满目空花降白雪。 一阳来复亥子交，当中现出团圆月。 急忙下手用功夫，金逢望远不堪摘。 呼吸运起玄关火，青天劈破鸿氵蒙裂。 黄河逆转上昆仑，九窍三关都透辟。 化为琼浆吞入腹，哑子吃蜜难分说。 到此功程要谨慎，采取沐浴按时节。 二品阴阳物类同，两般内外火符别。 灵药得来片晌时，温养还须十个月。 老成更要过三年，三三如九面丹避。 丹成长啸出山去，隐显立功着化迹。 上帝闻名下紫书，诏我朝天飞空碧。 后人依此用勤修，便是三清会上客。 打坐歌 初打坐，学参禅，这个消息在玄关。 秘秘绵绵调呼吸，一阴一阳眉内煎。 性要悟，命要传，休将火候当等闲。 闭目观心守本命，清净无为是根源。 百日内，见应验，坎中一点往上翻。 黄婆其间为媒灼，婴儿姹女两团圆。 美不尽，对谁言，浑身上下气冲天。 这个消息谁知道，哑子做梦不能言。 急下手。 采先天，灵药一点透三关。 丹田直上泥丸顶，降下重楼大中元。 水火既济真铅汞，若非戊己不成丹。 必要死，命要坚，神光照耀遍三千。 无影树下金鸡叫，半夜三更现红莲。 冬至一阳来复始。 霹虏一声震动天。 龙又叫，虎又欢，仙乐齐鸣非等闲。 恍恍惚惚存有无。 无穷造化在其间。 玄中妙，妙中玄，河车搬运过三关。 天地交泰万物生，日饮甘露似蜜甜。 仙是佛。 佛是仙，一性圆明不二般。 三教原来是一家，饥则吃饭四则眠。 假烧香，拜参禅，岂知大道在目前！ 昏迷吃斋错过了。 一失人身万动难。 愚迷妄想西天路，瞎汉夜走入深山。 元机妙，非等闲，漏泄天机罪如山。 四正理。 着意参，打破玄关妙通玄。 子午卯酉不断夜，早拜明师结成丹。 有人识得真铅汞，便是长生不老仙。 行一日，一日坚，莫把修行眼下观。 二年九载功成就，炼成一粒紫金丹。 要知此歌何人作，清虚道人三丰仙。 道要秘诀歌 道要歌，道要歌，不知道要必遭魔。 看玄关，调真息，知斯二要修行毕。 以元神，入气海，神气交融默默时，使得一玄真主宰。 将元气，入黄庭，气神和合昏昏际，又得一玄最圆明。 一玄妙，一玄窍，有欲观窍无观妙。 两者玄玄是真机，异名同出谁知道。 看玄关，无他诀，先从窍内调真息。 神恬气静极自然，妙自无生现太极。 古仙翁，多半语，恐泄真机不妄举。 或言有定在中央。 或言无定自领取。 到而今，我尽言，此在有定无定间。 有定曰窍无曰妙，老君所说玄又玄。 指分明，度有情，留与吾门作赏音。 遇而不修为下鬼，为圣为凡随乎人。 初下手，最难行，离了散乱又昏沉。 大上人，有真学，必将神气分清浊。 先天神今最清明，后天神兮乃浊物。 扫除浊物守清明，闭塞三宝居灵谷。 这灵谷。 即窍儿，窍中调息要深思。 一息去，一息来，息息相依时相偎。 幽幽细细无人觉，神气团冲九窍开。 照此行持得窍妙，昏沉散乱从何来？ 大道歌 君今洗耳听吾言，道有先天与后天。 后天渣质为无用，先天一点号真铅。 昧真铅。 迷本性，此是修行第一病。 玉清殿上少人行。 吾今指破神仙境。 命要传，性要悟，入圣超凡由汝做。
chunks.translated_text:
There are no crescents nor full moons, no bathings nor lengthy scriptures.
Strange names swept away, metaphors cleared—
only these two lines hold the true essence.

**Song of Realizing the Dao**
The spirit does not wander outward, essence does not leak.
Qi is not dissipated; the numinous sprout takes root.
The Five Phases and Four Images enter the Central Palace—
why fear the golden elixir will not form itself?
Within dwells the true spirit, without appear responses;
all around, empty blossoms descend like white snow.
At the return of the first yang, *hai* and *zi* converge,
and within appears the full round moon.
Hasten to apply effort—
gold, once at its fullest, cannot be plucked.
Breath stirs the fire of the Mysterious Pass,
cleaving the azure sky and rending the primordial mist.
The Yellow River flows backward to Kunlun’s heights,
the nine orifices and three barriers all open wide.
Transformed into nectar, it is swallowed into the belly—
a mute tasting honey, beyond words to tell.
At this stage of practice, be most vigilant:
gather and bathe in accord with the seasons.
The two grades of yin and yang share the same nature,
yet the firing times differ within and without.
The numinous medicine is obtained in a fleeting moment,
but its nurturing still requires ten months.
To mature further, pass through three years—
three threes like nine, and the elixir avoids all harm.
When the elixir is complete, let out a long whistle and depart the mountain,
leaving traces of concealment and manifestation in your wake.
The Celestial Emperor, hearing your name, sends down a purple writ,
summoning you to ascend the heavens in azure flight.
If later generations diligently cultivate by this,
they shall be guests at the assembly of the Three Pure Ones.

**Song of Sitting in Meditation**
At first, when sitting, learn to contemplate Chan—
this subtle message lies in the Mysterious Pass.
Secretly, subtly, regulate the breath,
yin and yang simmering between the brows.
Nature must be awakened, life transmitted—
do not treat the firing times as trivial.
With eyes closed, observe the heart and guard the original destiny;
purity and non-action are the root.
Within a hundred days, signs appear—
the point within *kan* flips upward.
The Yellow Dame acts as matchmaker,
the infant and the maiden unite in harmony.
The beauty is endless—
to whom can it be told?
The whole body surges with qi, piercing the heavens.
Who knows this subtle message?
A mute dreaming, unable to speak.
Act swiftly—
gather the primordial,
the numinous medicine’s single point piercing the three barriers.
From the cinnabar field it ascends straight to the *niwan* peak,
then descends past the heavy tower to the Great Central Origin.
Water and fire in harmony, true lead and mercury—
without *wu* and *ji*, the elixir cannot form.
Death must be embraced, life must be firm,
the radiance of spirit illuminating the three thousand worlds.
Beneath the shadowless tree, the golden rooster crows;
in the dead of night, the red lotus appears.
At winter solstice, the first yang begins its return—
a thunderclap shakes the heavens.
The dragon calls, the tiger rejoices,
celestial music resounds, no ordinary sound.
Vaguely, indistinctly, preserve being and non-being—
boundless transformations lie within.
Mystery within wonder, wonder within mystery,
the river chariot transports past the three barriers.
Heaven and earth in harmony, the ten thousand things are born;
daily drinking sweet dew, sweet as honey.
Immortal is Buddha,
Buddha is immortal—
a single nature, perfectly luminous, not two.
The Three Teachings were originally one family:
hungry, eat; tired, sleep.
Falsely burning incense, bowing in Chan—
how could they know the Great Dao lies before their eyes?
Deluded, they fast and miss the chance—
once the human body is lost, myriad kalpas pass in vain.
Foolishly chasing the Western Paradise,
a blind man stumbling into the deep mountains at night.
The primal mechanism is wondrous, not trivial—
to leak the celestial secret is a crime as heavy as mountains.

**Four Upright Principles**
With intent, contemplate:
break through the Mysterious Pass, wondrously penetrating the mystery.
*Zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you*—unceasing through the night,
early seek a bright teacher to congeal the elixir.
One who recognizes true lead and mercury
is an immortal of ageless life.
Cultivate day by day, firm each day—
do not view the practice with short-sighted eyes.
After two years and nine, the work is accomplished,
a single grain of purple golden elixir refined.
Would you know who composed this song?
The Pure Emptiness Daoist, the Immortal Zhang Sanfeng.

**Song of the Dao’s Essential Secrets**
The Dao’s essential song, the Dao’s essential song—
not knowing the essentials, one is surely beset by demons.
Observe the Mysterious Pass, regulate the true breath—
knowing these two essentials, cultivation is complete.
With the original spirit, enter the sea of qi;
when spirit and qi merge in silence, one attains the true sovereign of the first mystery.
With the original qi, enter the Yellow Court;
when qi and spirit harmonize in obscurity, one attains the most luminous second mystery.
One mystery is wondrous, one mystery is the aperture—
with desire, observe the aperture; without desire, observe the wonder.
These two mysteries are the true mechanism—
who knows they emerge from the same source under different names?
To observe the Mysterious Pass, there is no other secret:
first, from within the aperture, regulate the true breath.
Spirit serene, qi still—utterly natural—
the wonder spontaneously arises, the Supreme Ultimate appears.
The ancient immortals spoke mostly in half-words,
fearing to leak the true mechanism, they did not speak recklessly.
Some said it is fixed in the center,
others said it is formless and must be grasped intuitively.
Now, in this age, I speak fully—
it lies between the fixed and the formless.
Fixed is called the aperture, formless the wonder—
what Laozi called "mystery upon mystery."
Pointing clearly, I ferry the sentient—
leaving this for my disciples as a reward.
Meet it and not cultivate—become a lesser ghost;
to be sage or mortal rests with the person.

At the outset, practice is most difficult—
leaving distraction, only to sink into torpor.
The great superior person possesses true learning,
necessarily distinguishing spirit and qi into pure and turbid.
The primordial spirit is now most clear,
the postnatal spirit is but turbid matter.
Sweep away the turbid, guard the clear,
seal the Three Treasures within the numinous valley.
This numinous valley—
is the aperture.
Within the aperture, regulate the breath with deep reflection.
One breath goes, one breath comes,
each breath interdependent, each moment close.
Subtly, silently, unnoticed by others,
spirit and qi gather, surging through the nine orifices.
Practice thus to attain the aperture’s wonder—
whence could torpor and distraction arise?

**Song of the Great Dao**
Now, lend your ears to my words:
the Dao has the primordial and the postnatal.
The postnatal dregs are of no use—
the primordial’s single point is called true lead.
To be ignorant of true lead,
to lose one’s original nature—
this is the first illness of cultivation.
Few walk the path to the Jade Clarity Palace—
I now point out the immortal’s realm.
Life must be transmitted, nature must be awakened—
to ascend as sage or transcend as immortal rests with you.

chunks.translated_text:
**Quiet Practice Awakens Nature, Movement Gathers the Elixir**
Within, the tortoise and serpent coil in inversion.
At the stirring of the single yang, begin the work—
turning the Celestial Gate demands fierce vigor.
Yin arises at noon within the yang of Kan,
while at Mao and You, proceed with measured calm.
The Dipper’s handle turns the wheel toward the Purple Palace,
laughing to welcome the young guest, Master Huang.

In the Palace of the Yellow Dame, meet the Maiden of Mystery—
the Maiden and the Infant pair of their own accord.
To lay the foundation, refine the self;
refine it to purity, then gather with clarity.
My obscure master taught me this segment of practice:
first open the nine orifices by unsealing the gates.
The nine orifices originate at the Weilu point—
begin at the soles’ bubbling springs, surging upward.
From the bubbling springs, rise gradually to the knees;
below the knees, the work demands exertion.
The Buddhists call this "reed sprouts,"
or liken it to insects creeping, thorns piercing.
Pass the knees slowly to reach the Weilu,
where a hard object seems to resist.
Only then proceed with all higher practices—
three stages of work, each with its oral formula.
Once the three passes converge in one opening,
turn it upward to the Mud Pill Palace.
Pierce the Golden Lock Gate, descend the Magpie Bridge—
the Twelve-Storied Tower, how wondrous indeed!
The Twelve-Storied Tower is the Crimson Palace,
and within the Crimson Palace lies the Yellow Court.
The Yellow Court’s chamber must be refined;
its essence is the single luminous point at its center.
Never mistake obscurity for secrecy—
the Yellow Court is the true Mysterious Pass.
If you fail to recognize the Mysterious Pass in its true place,
where can true lead arrive and settle?

Have you not seen the *Awakening to Reality* poem?
"Only by the Mysterious Female can the root be established."
When true essence returns, the golden void remains—
a single luminous pearl never departs.
Have you not read the *Triple Concordance*?
"It resembles Penglai, no falsehood in the comparison."
Closing below is called the supreme closure of the existent;
the two apertures’ method requires qi’s mutual dependence.
From now on, when discoursing on the Dao or expounding on the profound,
all else is vain without this.

Once the gates are opened and merit is accumulated,
forging the sword demands understanding the true message.
Even Moye was wrought from iron—
how much more is my sword inherently straight!
Heaven is the furnace, earth the forge;
gold and water must balance—never act recklessly.
At Zi and Wu, practice to temper it,
able to be hard or soft, to take or discard.
When the sword is complete, gather true lead—
gather the primordial chaos before it divides.
If you receive only postnatal qi,
you merely extend his lifespan.

At the second watch of the seventh day, the true mechanism appears—
seek it within the divine land of the Red Continent.
If you obtain both method and resource,
then carefully ponder and distinguish.
Pink clouds, the hue of a pheasant’s plumage,
lips like cinnabar, skin as snow.
Wise and intelligent, nature gentle and kind,
eyes like lacquered pearls, hair pure black.
Qi clear, gaze steady, steps measured—
only then calculate the months and years within.
Five thousand four hundred births yield the Yellow Path,
dim and distant, born of vagueness.
Gather in accord with the time, determining rise and fall—
not a hair’s breadth may be transgressed.
At this juncture, know the crescent moon’s third day;
the wonder lies in the west’s Geng and Xin, white.
The sword of wisdom sharp, the inner heart sincere,
strike the bamboo to resonate, then pluck the zither.
The Heavenly Ladder must be used—never omitted!
Who can fathom such profound and secret mechanisms?
Do not recklessly fish the giant turtle from the sea’s depths,
lest you startle it away, never to return.

Guard the furnace without damage, distinguish the timing with care—
gathering postnatal qi only extends the years.
One double-hour divides into six watches;
the elixir forms in just two watches.
The remaining four watches hold divine work—
the wonder lies in heart-transmission, hard to divulge.

When true lead arrives, ignite the spiritual fire—
from west to east, first seek me.
Move my true mercury, a single red point,
to meet and merge into one pearl.
Pass the three passes, ascend to the Mud Pill Palace,
descend the Twelve-Storied Tower, vast and cold.
Neither foolish nor wise,
neither sober nor drunk.
If not for expending spirit throughout the body,
how could husband and wife unite as a pair?

Once the elixir is settled, the heart toils at dusk and dawn—
the *Zhun* and *Meng* hexagrams respond at dawn and dusk.
Know that bathing occurs within them—
at Mao and You, do not advance.
Guard the city walls, cease the martial work,
and the crucible fills with numinous cinnabar, crimson.
After ten months, the work is complete—
the vessel, the elixir chamber, all emptied.
Enter the deep mountains, embrace the One,
all things voided, effortless.
Cold, heat, hunger, and toil cannot assail you;
for nine majestic years, face the wall.
From the Northern Sea at dawn to Yingzhou at dusk,
suddenly, when merit and practice are complete,
the Three Officials of the Water Palace tally your years—
a sealed elixir missive descends from the Jade Heaven,
green luan and white cranes dance, their wings flapping.
Only when enlightenment is thorough and investiture complete
will you forever become an ageless immortal.

**Song of the True Bellows**
Do not say the Great Dao acts through non-action—
why then fiddle with the bellows in the chamber?
When desire stirs, not a moment’s rest,
purple qi and red light flicker wildly.
The Azure Dragon rejoices, the White Tiger despises—
the Azure Dragon coils around the tortoise’s shell.
Two streams of true qi pierce the Celestial Palace,
decisively ascending to the Three Clarities’ Pavilion.
Within the pavilion, a jade pool is clearly seen,
holding the medicine of ageless life.
Gather it in due time and consume it—
then enjoy the bliss of Penglai.

**Song of the Mysterious Pass**
The Mysterious Pass, a single aperture, holds the true formula—
heaven and earth split open, Penglai’s vastness revealed.
In the Yellow Court dwells an original elder,
holding the zither, awaiting the moon at the sky’s edge.
The second water is clear, the third water turbid—
when the golden flower blooms, the Dui trigram’s head is incomplete.
On Mount Emei, purple mist flies,
the mist transforms, melting the red furnace’s snow.
The dragon’s chant compels, the tiger’s roar presses—
the numinous tortoise drinks the Golden Crow’s blood.
Riding the dragon, sword at the waist, drunk and returning home,
turn the three passes to face the Northern Palace.

**Oral Formula for Refining Lead**
The Supreme Dao, proclaimed again and again,
reveals the distinction between the primordial and the postnatal.
It speaks only of lead born after Gui,
not of yang arising before Gui.
Rein in the horse of the mind, lock the monkey of the heart;
without stray thoughts, the intent must be single.
Sever greed and anger, extinguishing the three poisons;
eradicate love and desire, driving away the five thieves.
The Flowery Pond’s water, the Upper Valley’s spring—
the ancients used these to moisten the three fields.

**Song of the Great Dao**
Now, lend your ears to my words:
the Dao has the primordial and the postnatal.
The postnatal dregs are of no use—
the primordial’s single point is called true lead.
To be ignorant of true lead,
to lose one’s original nature—
this is the first illness of cultivation.
Few walk the path to the Jade Clarity Palace—
I now point out the immortal’s realm.
Life must be transmitted, nature must be awakened—
to ascend as sage or transcend as immortal rests with you.

chunks.original_text: 若知返本延年药，须是还丹续命铅。 出北海，走西川，施匠手，种金莲。 生擒虎髓炉中炼，活捉龟精鼎内煎。 先天气，太素烟，醍醐一灌驻容颜。 得了任他寒暑变，服之跳出生死关。 寻酋经，觅初弦，吾今指出妙中元。 水火既济交一遍，阴阳会合数三千。 到彼岸，不须船，灭虑除情绝妄缘。 静静清清看命宝，昏昏默默守胎仙。 受辛苦，二三年，阳神出现圣功圆。 养火无虞全造化，长生不老寿同天。 金丹歌 金丹一粒重一斤，世人知得永长生。 筑基扫尽尘间事，炼己只是养元神。 黄庭土釜先天汞，万虑皆空绝世情。 离了己身不是道，执着己身也是空。 我今泄漏天机理，说与学道诸英雄。 目前现有长生路，千万凡夫迷本宗。 扫尽灵台无一念，身闲清静运玄功。 呼吸虚无神守舍，百脉归源如水清。 身中自有真铅现，一颗红光似月明。 玄关往来无定位，阴阳升降有时辰。 年中取月月取日，中秋现出月光轮。 三旬只在家里坐，时刻不离紫微星。 南面对观北斗柄，正是日午打二更。 西北安炉炼灵药，东商立鼎法神功。 鼎炉相对真做手，慧剑挂在水晶宫。 黄婆勾引为媒娉，灵龟火炉深更深。 醍醐灌顶真橐龠，采取先天一气真。 一息一纽天谷穴，河车搬运上昆仑。 过了鹊桥入华池，降下重楼十二层。 尾闾夹脊三关过，金公归舍大黄庭。 铅来投汞猫捕鼠，汞去投铅兔见鹰。 九转神丹大金鼎，十月胎完造化成。 寒暑不知真造化，体变纯阳是真金。 尘中积行三千满，白日飞升朝玉京。 金液还丹破迷歌 还丹诀，还丹诀，吾今仔细与君说。 劳门小本路三千，除此金丹都是僻。 万般渣质皆非小，真阴真阳正栽接。 阴阳交。 铅汞接，婴儿姹女空中烈。 龙虎上下转升腾，海底灵龟弄星月。 长黄芽，飞白雪，水中金露先天诀。 真黄婆，真橐龠，金丹就是长生药。 先筑基，后进药，百日工夫牢抱着。 若追二气归黄道，三家相见仙胎结。 性要炼，命要接，休在人间虚岁月。 若将铅汞归真土，添汞拙铅永不灭。 乌八两，兔半斤，二物同入戊己村。 两头武，中间文，四象擒来一处烹。 十月功勤火候足，纯阳炼就寿无穷。 换鼎移胎三五载，九年面壁出阳神。 玄是祖，牝是宗，先天先地万般根。 点开透地通天眼，斡转天关斗逆行。 窍要开，气自通，雷转斗柄声正轰。 海底云汲龙翻浪，泥丸风生虎啸声。 若会阴阳颠倒法，乾坤造化立时成。 讲《悟真》，说《参同》，此理原来是一宗。 此药虽从房中得，金丹大药事不同。 饶服杰，空炼精，闭尾闾，望飞升，不得金丹总不成。 鸟兽类，知全形，龟纳鼻息能调气，鹿运尾闾亦炼精。 又有鹤胎常稳抱，夜伴云松静养神。 畜生到有千年寿，为人反不悟长生。 遍世人，贪利名，不怕阎罗鬼簿情。 人有生灭畜有死，三才气断鬼为邻。 先天药，后天药，此是阴阳真妙物。 先天药，能超脱，后天药，延命壳。 世人若会栽接机，长生不死还大觉。 性要修，命要全，来得先天种泥丸。 童儿修，精气全，静里一杰可升天。 只有无为身不破，才是修真大罗仙。 幼年间，丧元阳，半路出家性颠狂。 乾爻走入坤爻照，变成离卦内虚张。 取将坎位中心实，返本还原复作阳。 真水火，配阴阳，世人莫要乱思量。 饶你无为空打坐，不免亡身葬北邙。
chunks.translated_text:
If you would know the medicine for returning to the root and extending years,
you must refine the returning elixir, the life-continuing lead.
Forth from the Northern Sea, through the Western River,
under the craftsman’s hand, plant the golden lotus.
Capture alive the tiger’s marrow to refine in the furnace,
seize the turtle’s essence to simmer in the cauldron.
The primordial qi, the mist of Great Simplicity—
a single draught of ghee preserves the countenance.
Once attained, let cold and heat transform as they will;
ingest it, and leap beyond the gate of life and death.

Seek the crescent in the scriptures, trace the new moon’s arc—
I now reveal the wondrous Central Origin.
When water and fire achieve balance in one cycle,
yin and yang unite in three thousand reckonings.
At the farther shore, no boat is needed;
extinguish thoughts, dissolve passions, sever false ties.
In stillness and clarity, behold the treasure of life;
in dimness and silence, guard the embryonic immortal.
Endure hardship for two or three years,
and the yang spirit emerges, sacred work complete.
Tend the fire without fear, mastering creation—
eternal life, ageless as heaven.

**Song of the Golden Elixir**
One grain of golden elixir weighs a pound;
whoever knows it attains eternal life.
Lay the foundation, sweeping away worldly affairs;
refine the self, only to nurture the primordial spirit.
The Yellow Court’s earthen crucible, the primordial mercury—
all cares dissolve, worldly passions cease.
Departing the self is not the Dao;
clinging to the self is also void.

I now disclose the celestial mechanism’s principle,
speaking to all heroic seekers of the Dao.
Before your eyes lies the path to eternal life,
yet ten thousand mortals stray from the original source.
Sweep the spirit-terrace clean of every thought,
body at ease, in stillness enact the mysterious work.
Breath in emptiness, spirit guarding the chamber,
a hundred meridians return to the source like limpid water.
Within the body, true lead manifests—
a single crimson radiance, bright as the moon.
The Mysterious Pass comes and goes without fixed place;
yin and yang ascend and descend by the hour.
Within the year, take the month; within the month, take the day;
at mid-autumn, the moon’s orb appears.
For thirty days, remain seated at home,
never apart from the Purple Tenuity star.
Facing south, observe the Northern Dipper’s handle—
just as the sun reaches noon, the second watch strikes.
In the northwest, set the furnace to refine the numinous medicine;
in the east, erect the cauldron to enact the divine work.
Cauldron and furnace face each other, true hands at work;
the sword of wisdom hangs in the Crystal Palace.
The Yellow Dame beckons as matchmaker,
the numinous turtle and fire furnace in the deep of night.
Ghee poured upon the crown, the true bellows—
gather the primordial qi in its authenticity.
Each breath a twist at the Celestial Valley’s point,
the river chariot transports it up Mount Kunlun.
Crossing the Magpie Bridge, it enters the Flowery Pond,
descending the twelve-story tower of the Lofty Mansion.
Passing the Tail Gate, the spine’s three passes—
the Metal Lord returns to the great Yellow Court.
Lead comes to seek mercury, cat pouncing on mouse;
mercury goes to seek lead, hare spying hawk.
Nine revolutions of the divine elixir in the great golden crucible,
ten months of gestation, creation perfected.
Unaware of cold or heat, true creation—
the body transformed to pure yang, true gold.
Accumulate three thousand deeds in the dust,
and ascend at daylight to the Jade Capital.

**Song of the Returning Elixir, Breaking Delusion**
The returning elixir’s formula, the returning elixir’s formula—
I now explain it to you in careful detail.
The Gate of Toil’s minor path spans three thousand leagues;
all else but this golden elixir is a byway.
Ten thousand dross qualities are no trifle—
true yin and true yang are the proper graft.
Yin and yang unite,
lead and mercury join;
infant and maiden blaze in the void.
Dragon and tiger ascend and descend, revolving;
the numinous turtle at the sea’s bottom plays with stars and moon.
The long yellow sprout, flying white snow—
the water’s golden dew is the primordial formula.
The true Yellow Dame, the true bellows—
the golden elixir is the medicine of eternal life.
First lay the foundation, then advance the medicine;
a hundred days’ work must be firmly held.
If you guide the two qi back to the Yellow Path,
the three families meet, the immortal embryo forms.
Refine the nature, join the life;
do not waste months and years among men.
If you return lead and mercury to true earth,
add mercury, refine lead, and they never perish.
The crow, eight ounces; the hare, half a pound—
both enter the village of Wu and Ji.
Martial at both ends, civil in the center,
the four images captured and simmered together.
Ten months of diligent work, the fire’s timing complete—
pure yang refined, life without end.
Transfer the cauldron, shift the embryo for three to five years;
nine years facing the wall, the yang spirit emerges.
Mysterious is the ancestor, the female the origin—
the primordial, the earth, the root of all things.
Pierce the eye that sees through earth and heaven,
turn the Celestial Pass, the Dipper’s handle in reverse.
Open the aperture, qi flows of itself;
the thunder turns the Dipper’s handle with a mighty roar.
At the sea’s bottom, clouds draw water, dragons churn waves;
at the Mud Pill, wind rises, tigers roar.
If you master the method of inverting yin and yang,
creation of heaven and earth is accomplished in an instant.

Expound the *Awakening to Reality*, discourse on the *Unity of the Three*—
this principle was originally one.
Though this medicine is obtained from the chamber,
the great medicine of the golden elixir is not the same.
Even if you refine essence with surpassing skill,
seal the Tail Gate, and long for ascension—
without the golden elixir, all is in vain.
Birds and beasts know how to preserve their forms:
the turtle draws breath through its nose to regulate qi,
the deer circulates qi at the Tail Gate to refine essence.
The crane’s embryo is ever steadfastly held,
by night it companions clouds and pines in tranquil nurture.
Beasts may attain a thousand years of life,
yet men fail to awaken to eternal life.
Throughout the world, men covet profit and fame,
heedless of the King of Hell’s ledger.
Men are born and die, beasts perish—
when the three powers’ qi severs, ghosts become neighbors.

The primordial medicine, the postnatal medicine—
these are the true wondrous things of yin and yang.
The primordial medicine can transcend,
the postnatal medicine extends the life-shell.
If men grasp the mechanism of grafting,
they attain eternal life and great enlightenment.
Refine the nature, complete the life—
attain the primordial seed to plant in the Mud Pill.
The youth who cultivates, with essence and qi complete,
in stillness, a single spark can ascend to heaven.
Only the formless body remains unbroken—
this is the Great Luo Immortal of true cultivation.
In youth, one loses primordial yang;
midway through life, leaving home, the nature runs wild.
The yang line enters the yin line’s reflection,
becoming the Li trigram, inwardly hollow.
Take the solid center of the Kan position,
return to the root, revert to yang.
True water and fire pair yin and yang—
men must not indulge in reckless thoughts.
Though you sit in emptiness, practicing non-action,
you cannot escape death, buried on Mount Beimang.

chunks.original_text: 习静功，守中黄，到老差殊枉一场。 纵然明了真如性，阴魄投胎入鬼乡。 延命药，返魂浆，金丹就是药中正。 若将一粒吞归腹，返老还童寿命长。 又休妻，又绝粮，持斋说法往西方。 任你旁门千万法，除斯同类总成狂。 我把天机都泄漏，还丹端的是仙方。 累代神仙从此得，脱离尘世上天堂。 我劝后来学道者，休听邪师说短长。 若得口诀金丹药，延年住世寿无疆。 以此修出长生路，报答师恩谢上苍。 着斯诀，作慈航，行满功圆感玉皇。 破迷金液谁人作？ 万古流传元化张。 龙虎还丹指迷歌二首 饶君到处问仙梯，一阳初动始称奇。 水淹昆仑翻碧海，虎啸岩头是祖基。 直指逍遥捷径处，一轮明月照须弥。 水中虎，火中龙，八卦五行显耀中。 捉得龙兮生紫雾，伏了虎兮金花露。 二象何缘立道根？ 只因久假曹溪路。 男配女，阴配阳，交媾分明战一场。 戊己土，作黄房，神气清兮是药王。 炼得紫金丹粒就，跨鹤乘鸾朝玉皇。 虎藏碧海伴儿眠，龙自扶桑日里旋。 待等一阳春意动，虎放金光龙吐涎。 腰悬宝剑收龙雾，虎见龙归自共潜。 二物相随归戊已，一炉真火慢烹煎。 子至年，火候严，卯酉加临莫放闲。 吞祖气，啖琼浆，色内真空那个详！ 炼之只在生身处，十殿冥王共此方。 速顿悟，莫痴贪，休道老人说异端。 饶尔翻谈三藏法，不悟无生也是闲。 打破这个铁馒头，自在逍遥亿万年。 注《九皇丹经》三月生魂金丹三还一返歌 一月一月，都是少莲花里真精血。 不须安炉立鼎，只用无为抽彻。 也不候两弦气到，候只候印堂星阙。 也不候八两半斤为活子，候只候五千四百正当月。 不用神交与体隔，只用上呼下吸两○说。 一来浑身暖，二来囟门彻，三来天目开，便见大千世界，此等效验处方,是生胞生胎生魂的的来.分付修仙子,须向云中跨鹤,切莫沙土中埋。 注《九皇丹经》四月生魄金丹四还二返歌 老祖名为降魔护道祖，贯通七魄制于酉。 酉内有真金，金能保长生。 帝真魄命元，从此妙元元。 洞房花烛夜，对境忘情耶。 嗒哩口耶，口摩哩耶，金咤木咤口它喃口耶，口奄，似我也，似我也，南无般若波罗密耶。 注《九皇丹经》七月开心七窍金丹七还五返歌 道君坐太微，降生大天尊。 垂此真法语，引人上玉清。 一个字诀，七个月象形。 左二右三名为五，太极浑然有五灵。 五灵方得七窍开，须把天目运此来。 叫人修真的的是，穿破机关上琼台。 注《九皇丹经》十月形神坚固金丹十还歌 弄玉仙姑吹玉箫，声声吹入元关窍，此窍名为天地根。 先天足来百景自生神，八景生了二十四诸天，九窍自通灵。 圣胎原借真一杰，王母瑶池泛金液，莲花心。 心心合着黄芽，生香在里锦乾坤。 夺得真香妙氤氲，保我劫劫常存。 自从纯阳道祖一泄此，万世贤良细用心。 蓬莱岛，当留名，瀛洲会。 须效许真对，白日间拨宅飞升。 三年今日苦叮吁，但愿人人俱有寿，阳合元根。 固漏歌 说玄妙，讲玄妙。 运精神，转九窍，三关八门都撞倒。 闭敢房，修丹灶厂休将六贼来喧闹。 主人翁，哈哈笑，守住黄庭。 傲要。 婴儿来，姥女叭两家一处成玄妙。 绪金丹，怀中抱，浑身，一片霞光照。 坐丹田，清虚号，紫气红光常晃耀，上至须弥泥丸"，下至涌泉彻幽奥。
chunks.translated_text:
Cultivate stillness, guard the Central Yellow—
to old age, all differences are vain effort.
Even if you comprehend the true suchness of nature,
the yin soul reincarnates, entering the realm of ghosts.

The elixir of life, the nectar of returning soul—
the Golden Elixir is the true medicine within.
Swallow but a single grain into the belly,
and you reverse aging, restore youth, prolong life.

Forsake your wife, renounce grain,
hold fast to the fast, expound the Dharma, journey to the West.
No matter how many heterodox methods you master,
all apart from this path are but madness.

I have revealed all the celestial mechanisms—
the Returned Elixir is indeed the immortal’s formula.
Generations of immortals attain this,
transcending the mortal world to ascend to heaven.

I exhort later Dao seekers:
heed not the false teachers’ deceptive words.
If you obtain the oral transmission of the Golden Elixir,
you will extend years, abide in the world, live boundlessly.

By this cultivation, you tread the path of eternal life,
repaying your master’s grace, giving thanks to heaven.
Hold fast to this secret,
make it your compassionate vessel.
When merit is complete and work perfected,
you move the Jade Emperor’s heart.

Who crafted the Golden Liquid that breaks delusion?
From ancient times, it has flowed forth from Yuanhua Zhang.

---

**Two Songs of the Dragon-Tiger Returned Elixir, Pointing the Path to Delusion**

Though you inquire everywhere for the immortal’s ladder,
only at the first stirring of yang does it become wondrous.
Water submerges Kunlun, overturning the azure sea;
the tiger’s roar on the cliff is the ancestral foundation.

This directly points to the carefree shortcut—
a bright moon illuminates Mount Sumeru.
The tiger in water, the dragon in fire,
within the Eight Trigrams and Five Phases, they manifest radiance.

Seize the dragon—purple mist arises;
subdue the tiger—golden floral dew appears.
How do these two images establish the root of the Dao?
Only because they have long borrowed the path of Caoxi.

Male pairs with female, yin pairs with yang,
their union clearly a battle.
Wu-ji soil forms the Yellow Chamber—
when spirit and qi are pure, it is the King of Medicines.

Refine the grain of Purple Gold Elixir,
and you ride the crane, mount the phoenix, to pay homage to the Jade Emperor.
The tiger hides in the azure sea, slumbering with the child;
the dragon circles the Fusang tree in the sun’s light.

Wait until the yang of spring stirs,
the tiger emits golden light, the dragon spits saliva.
With a treasured sword at your waist, gather the dragon’s mist;
when the tiger sees the dragon return, they submerge together.

The two creatures follow one another to Wu-ji,
in a crucible of true fire, slowly simmered.
From midnight to the year’s end, the firing times are strict;
at dawn and dusk, do not neglect the work.

Swallow the ancestral qi, consume the jade nectar—
who understands true emptiness within form?
Refinement lies solely in the place of one’s birth;
the Ten Kings of Hell share this method.

Hasten to awaken, do not be foolishly greedy—
do not call the old man’s words heresy.
Though you expound the Three Treasuries’ Dharma,
without awakening to non-arising, it is all in vain.

Break open this iron steamed bun,
and you will roam carefree for billions of years.

---

**Three-Month Song of the Nine Augusts’ Elixir Canon: The Elixir of the Soul’s Birth, Three Returns to One**

Month by month,
all are the true essence and blood within the young lotus.
No need to set up the furnace or establish the crucible—
only use non-action to draw it through.

Nor wait for the qi of the two crescents;
wait only for the star palace between the brows.
Nor wait for eight taels or half a catty as the living child;
wait only for the exact moment of five thousand four hundred.

No need for spirit to commune across bodily separation—
only use the two ○ of upper exhalation and lower inhalation.
First, the whole body warms;
second, the fontanel opens;
third, the celestial eye opens—
then you see the great thousandfold world.
At this point of efficacy, it is truly
the birth of the embryo, the birth of the fetus, the birth of the soul.

Instruct the immortal-seeking disciples:
you must ride the crane amidst the clouds,
never be buried in the sands and dust.

---

**Four-Month Song of the Nine Augusts’ Elixir Canon: The Elixir of the Po’s Birth, Four Returns to Two**

The Venerable Ancestor is named the Demon-Quelling Protector of the Dao,
permeating the seven po, mastering them at you.
Within you lies true gold—
gold can preserve eternal life.
The imperial true po, the life’s origin,
from this, the wondrous primordial arises.

On the wedding night in the bridal chamber,
facing circumstances, forget passion.
*Tali kou ye, kou mo li ye,
jin zha mu zha kou ta nan kou ye, kou yan,
si wo ye, si wo ye,
namo prajñā-pāramitā ye.*

---

**Seven-Month Song of the Nine Augusts’ Elixir Canon: The Elixir of Opening the Heart and Seven Orifices, Seven Returns to Five**

The Dao Lord sits in the Grand Tenuity,
descending as the Great Heavenly Honored One.
He bestows these true Dharma words,
guiding people to the Jade Purity.

A single-character secret,
seven months as its form.
Two on the left, three on the right, called five—
the Supreme Ultimate is naturally endowed with five numina.

Only when the five numina attain it do the seven orifices open;
you must move the celestial eye to come here.
Those who truly cultivate the Dao
pierce the mechanism to ascend the jeweled terrace.

---

**Ten-Month Song of the Nine Augusts’ Elixir Canon: The Elixir of Firmness of Form and Spirit, Ten Returns**

The Immortal Maiden of Jade Flute plays her jade flute,
each note blowing into the primordial pass—
this pass is called the root of heaven and earth.
When the primordial is sufficient, a hundred scenes naturally give birth to spirit;
the eight scenes give birth to the twenty-four heavens,
and the nine orifices naturally open to the numinous.

The sacred embryo originally borrows a single true spark;
the Queen Mother’s Jasper Pool brims with golden liquid,
the lotus heart.
Heart after heart unites with the yellow sprout,
fragrance arises within, brocading heaven and earth.

Seizing the true fragrance’s wondrous mist,
it preserves me for kalpas, ever abiding.
Ever since the Pure Yang Patriarch revealed this,
generations of the worthy have applied their minds.

On Penglai Isle, your name shall remain;
at the Yingzhou Assembly, you shall meet.
You must emulate Master Xu,
who in broad daylight raised his dwelling and ascended.

Three years of earnest exhortation today—
may all people possess longevity,
yang uniting with the primordial root.

---

**Song of Securing the Leak**

Speak of the mysterious, expound the mysterious—
move the spirit, turn the nine orifices,
knock down the three passes and eight gates.
Close the Grotto Chamber, refine the elixir furnace—
do not let the six thieves cause clamor.

The master laughs heartily,
guarding the Yellow Court.
Ah!
The infant comes, the crone and maiden—
the two families unite in wondrous mystery.

Bind the Golden Elixir, hold it in your embrace—
the whole body,
a radiant glow shines.
Sit in the Cinnabar Field, called the Pure Void—
purple qi and red light ever gleam,
rising to Mount Sumeru and the Mud Pill,
descending to the Bubbling Spring, penetrating the profound.

this is the Great Luo Immortal of true cultivation.
In youth, one loses primordial yang;
midway through life, leaving home, the nature runs wild.
The yang line enters the yin line’s reflection,
becoming the Li trigram, inwardly hollow.
Take the solid center of the Kan position,
return to the root, revert to yang.
True water and fire pair yin and yang—
men must not indulge in reckless thoughts.
Though you sit in emptiness, practicing non-action,
you cannot escape death, buried on Mount Beimang.

chunks.original_text: 七宝池内将宝盗，杂精杂气都不要。 琼枝玉蕊金花新，珊瑚玛瑙车王渠造。 固漏身，固漏窍，不漏铛，固漏攀，十二重楼都开导，七经八脉合三焦，百骸四体皆征效。 大肠周，小肠烁，上下鹊桥平稳趋。 赵州桥上去饮茶，甘河里边听大叫。 大运通，小运到，三家相见阿欢乐。 我把一身固漏坚，万载千秋无老少。 赞曰：固漏形躯炼太阳，精杰神全守中黄。 铅汞熬煎成至宝，金丹一粒放毫光。 婴儿显象长相守，与天同寿免无常。 有人学得《固漏歌》，便是长生不老方。 后了道歌 混世虫，混世界，终日混，无宁奈。 真孔窍，人不解，寻得着，真门在。 莫人吝，莫人爱，无人嫌，无人怪。 不参禅，不礼拜，不打坐，懒受戒。 走天涯，看世界，遇酒吃几杯，遇肉啖几块，化碗饭，塞皮袋，寻块布，遮四大，房屋破，自家盖，主人公，要安泰。 不登名利场，不臀成和败，不欠国家粮，不少儿女债。 他来寻我，我无挂碍。 朝游五湖边，暮宿青山内，顽石当枕头，青天作被盖。 虎豹不能侵，妖魔不敢害，不觉睡到日头红，无恐无惊无怖骇。 从今打破晃非门，翻身跳出红尘外。 拍手打掌笑呵呵，自在向在真自在。 回文诗 桥边院对柳塘湾，夜月明时半户关。 遥驾鹤来归洞晚，静弹琴坐伴云闲。 烧丹觅火无空灶，采药寻仙有好山。 瓢能树高人隐久，嚣尘绝水响潺潺。 金丹诗三十六首 养道归真 落魄江湖数十秋，逢师咬破铁馒头。 十分佳味谁调蜜？ 半夜残灯可着油！ 信道形神堪入妙，方知性命要全修。 自从会得些儿后，忘却人间万斛愁。 离尘旧隐 一片闲心绝世尘，震中寂静养精神。 素琴弹落天边月，玄酒倾残瓮底春。 正气朝元随日长，三花聚顶逐时新。 炼成大药超凡去，仔细题诗警后人。 扫境修心 纷纷内外景如麻，有地驰驱事可夸。 撒手不迷真捷径，回头返照即吾家。 六根清净无些障，五蕴虚空绝点暇。 了了忘忘方寸寂，一轮明月照南华。 力敌睡魔 气昏嗜卧害非轻，才到初更困倦生。 必有事焉常恐恐，只教心要强惺惺。 纵当意思形如醉，打起精神坐到明。 着此一鞭须猛省，做何事业不能成！ 一求玄关 一孔玄关要路头，非心非肾最深幽。 膀胱谷道空劳索，脾胃泥丸莫漫搜。 神气根基常恍惚，虚无窟里细探求。 原来只是灵明处，养就还丹跨鹤游。 再求玄关 傀儡当场会点头，应知总是线来抽。 抽他虽是依人力，使我人抽又孰谋？ 原赖主公常月白，期教到处好风流。 炼丹若要寻冬至，须向灵台静里求。 总论玄关 身即乾坤勿外求，虚灵一窍最深幽。 二三自许同为侣，一四何妨与共俦。 五土建中司发育，巽风起处定刚柔。 自从识得还元妙，六六宫中春复秋。 熔铸神剑 师传铸作青蛇法，坤鼎乾炉锻炼成。 非铁非金生杀气，无形无影自通灵。 掣来匣外乾坤窄，收入胸中芥子生。 万两黄金无觅处，隐然身衅斩妖精。 后天筑基 气败血衰宜补接； 明师亲授口中诀。 华池玉液逐时吞。 桃坞琼浆随日吸。 绝虑忘思赤子心，归根复命仙人业。 丹田温暖返童颜，笑煞顽空头似雪。
chunks.translated_text:
**Stealing Treasures from the Seven-Jewel Pool**

Steal the treasures from the Seven-Jewel Pool—
cast aside all impure essence and turbid qi.
Jade branches and golden blossoms ever new,
coral and agate, chariots wrought by the Wheel-King.

Secure the leaking body, seal the leaking orifices,
no leak in the cauldron, no leak in ascent.
The Twelve-Storied Tower stands open,
the seven meridians and eight vessels merge with the Triple Burner,
all bones and limbs bear witness.

The large intestine encircles, the small intestine glows,
above and below, the Magpie Bridge flows smooth.
Cross the Zhaozhou Bridge to drink tea,
by the Sweet River, heed the great cry.

The great cycle flows, the small cycle arrives—
the Three Families meet in joy.
I fortify this leaking body,
for ten thousand years, no old or young.

**In Praise:**
Secure the leaking form, refine the Great Yang,
essence, vitality, and spirit whole—guard the Central Yellow.
Lead and mercury simmered into supreme treasure,
a single grain of Golden Elixir radiates brilliance.
The Infant manifests, ever abiding,
attaining longevity to escape impermanence.
Whoever masters the *Song of Securing the Leak*
holds the formula for ageless life.

---

**Later Song of Realization**

A worm in the world, lost in the world,
drifting all day, no rest, no peace.
The true apertures—none understand;
find them, and the true gate appears.

No stinginess, no attachment,
no one to scorn, no one to blame.
No meditation, no prostrations,
no sitting in lotus, no lazy precepts.

Roam the ends of the earth, see the world,
meet wine—drink a few cups,
meet meat—eat a few bites.
Beg a bowl of rice, stuff the skin-bag,
find a scrap of cloth, cover the Four Great.
A broken house? Build it yourself.
The master within—seek peace.

No stepping into fame or profit,
no clinging to success or failure,
no debt to the state,
no burden of children’s debts.
If others seek me, I remain untroubled.

Morning wander by the five lakes,
evening rest in the green mountains.
A boulder for a pillow,
the blue sky as a blanket.
Tigers and leopards dare not intrude,
demons and monsters dare not harm.
Unaware, I sleep till the sun glows red,
no fear, no terror, no dread.

From now on, shatter the Gate of Illusion,
leap free beyond the red dust.
Clap hands, laugh heartily—
true freedom in true freedom.

---

**Palindrome Poem**

By the bridge, the courtyard faces the willow-lined bay,
moonlit night, half the door ajar.
From afar, the crane returns to the grotto late,
quietly strumming the lute, sitting with idle clouds.

Seeking fire for the elixir, no empty furnace,
gathering herbs for immortality, fine mountains abound.
The gourd hangs high—long has the hermit hidden,
far from the clamor, the stream’s murmur flows.

---

**Thirty-Six Poems on the Golden Elixir**

**Cultivating the Dao, Returning to Truth**

A wanderer on rivers and lakes for decades,
I met my master and bit through the iron steamed bun.
Who seasons the sweetest honey?
A midnight lamp with oil to spare!

Trust the Dao—form and spirit enter wonder,
only then know life and nature must be fully refined.
Since grasping this small truth,
I’ve forgotten the world’s ten thousand bushels of sorrow.

**Leaving the Dust, Old Recluse**

A heart at leisure, free of worldly dust,
in thunder’s stillness, nurturing spirit.
A plain lute plucks the moon from the sky,
dark wine drains the spring from the jar’s depths.

Vital qi ascends with the sun,
the Three Flowers gather at the crown, ever renewed.
Refining the Great Medicine to transcend the mortal,
I carefully inscribe these verses to warn later seekers.

**Sweeping the Mind, Cultivating the Heart**

Inside and out, a tangle of scenes like hemp—
where can one boast of deeds?
Let go—this is the true shortcut;
turn back, return to the light—this is home.

Six roots purified, without obstruction,
Five Aggregates emptied, flawless.
Utterly forgotten, the heart’s square inch still—
a bright moon illuminates *Nanhua*.

**Resisting the Sleep Demon**

Drowsy stupor harms more than lightly—
as soon as dusk falls, fatigue arises.
Always attend to matters with vigilance,
keep the heart fiercely awake.

Though the body may seem drunk,
rouse the spirit, sit till dawn.
With this whip, strike hard—awaken!
What endeavor cannot be achieved?

**Seeking the Mysterious Pass (I)**

A single aperture, the Mysterious Pass—gateway to the Way,
neither heart nor kidney, most profound and hidden.
Searching the bladder or perineum is vain labor,
sifting the spleen, stomach, or Mud Pill is futile.

The root of spirit and qi ever elusive,
delve deep into the cavern of emptiness.
It is but the place of numinous clarity—
nurture the Returned Elixir, ride the crane in flight.

**Seeking the Mysterious Pass (II)**

Puppets on stage nod in time,
know all is pulled by unseen strings.
Though pulled by another’s hand,
who commands my strings?

Rely on the Master’s constant moonlight,
ensure every place is graced with fine breeze.
To seek the elixir at Winter Solstice,
look within the quiet of the numinous terrace.

**On the Mysterious Pass**

The body is Qian and Kun—seek not without,
the numinous aperture, most profound and hidden.
Two or three may be companions,
one or four may join the fellowship.

Five Earths build the center, governing growth,
where the Xun wind rises, hardness and softness are fixed.
Since grasping the wonder of returning to the origin,
in the Six-Six Palace, spring and autumn recur.

**Forging the Spirit Sword**

The master transmits the method of forging the Green Snake,
tempered in the Kun crucible and Qian furnace.
Neither iron nor gold, yet brimming with life and death,
formless and shadowless, it moves with spirit.

Drawn from the scabbard, heaven and earth shrink,
sheathed in the breast, it fits within a mustard seed.
Worth ten thousand taels of gold, yet unfindable—
hidden in the body, it slays demons and spirits.

**Postnatal Foundation-Building**

Qi decayed, blood depleted—time to mend;
the enlightened master imparts the oral secret.
Jade fluid from the Flower Pool, swallow with the hours,
peach-blossom nectar, sip with the days.

Abandon thought, forget worry—return to the child’s heart,
root and life restored—immortal’s work.
The Cinnabar Field warms, the face regains youth,
mocking those who cling to empty heads of snow.

a radiant glow shines.
Sit in the Cinnabar Field, called the Pure Void—
purple qi and red light ever gleam,
rising to Mount Sumeru and the Mud Pill,
descending to the Bubbling Spring, penetrating the profound.

chunks.original_text: 后天炼己 炼己功夫谁得知； 精灵常与我相随。 一尘不染心俱静，万虑皆忘性若痴。 邪贼无由侵内境，学人终日侍严师。 饥来解饮长生酒，每日醺醺醉似泥。 炼己得药 炼己功夫继筑基，心头万虑已忘之。 一轮月色相为伴，五夜雷声独自知。 雪向静中飞白点，芽从虚里长黄枝。 夺队阳气归来孕，产个千年跨鹤儿。 炼己下手 体隔神交理甚详。 分明下手两相当。 安炉立鼎寻真种，对境忘情认本乡。 拿住龙头收紫雾，凿开虎尾露金光。 真铅一点吞归腹，万物生辉寿命长。 先天鼎器 一从识破鸿蒙窍，认得乾坤造化炉。 不用神功调水火，自然灵气透肌肤。 朝朝黄鹤藏金鼎，夜夜银蟾灌玉壶。 要识金丹端的事，未生身处下功夫。 先天真铅 举世人多好入玄，入玄不识这先天。 五千日内生黄道，三十时辰认黑铅。 不在乾坤分判后，只于父母末生前。 此般至宝家家有，自是愚人识见偏。 先天大药 信道金丹理最精，先天一点少人明。 不拘贫富家家有，无论贤愚种种生。 吞向腹中方有孕，将来掌上却无形。 世人问我难回答，遥指天边月出庚。 擒捉先天 笑睹神州有妙玄，耳边切切细相传。 凿开混沌寻金汞，劈破鸿氵蒙捉水铅。 黍米一珠含北海，蟾光万道照西川。 若人采得吞归腹，何虑凡夫不作仙。 凝聚先天 识得金丹正好为。 元微只向此中奇。 牝门一粒真铅动，玄户三家造化基。 凝结丹田生玉叶，送还土釜长琼芝。 世人欲达先天理，须认红花顶黑龟。 认药采取 日红海底山头月，灵山会上寻茄色。 花开鸟唱一天春，颠倒龙涎配虎血。 神光射入玉壶田，密数坤申子午诀。 刀主百日大丹成，丹成本做蓬莱客。 直指真铅 真铅本是月中华，西北相生共一家。 雌里怀雄威至宝，黑中取白见灵芽。 金多水少方为贵，阴盛阳衰末足夸。 更识其间包戊土，时时炉火起丹砂。 直指真汞 真汞原来日里精，东三南二白相生。 木中藏火非闲说，雄理怀雌是宝珍。 莫使一毫阴浊染，须教全体太阳明。 其间己土培元气，炼得灵芽渐长成。 铅汞相投 真铅真汞两相投，似漆如胶意末休。 以汞投铅如浴日，将铅制汞若添油。 铅调汞性常依傍，汞爱铅情乐泳游。 内外五行攒簇定，结成赤白大丹头。 颠倒妙用 寻真访道有何难，只要人心识倒颠。 休向山林寻至药，必须城市觅真铅。 青龙锁住离交坎，白虎牵回兑入乾。 此术效他行将去，自然有路上背天。 和合丹头 既生黄道始生亥，必有真阳应候回。 三昧火从离位发，一声雷自震宫来。 气神和合养灵质，心命相依结圣胎。 透得里头消息子，三关九窍一时开。 三家相见 央请黄婆善作媒。 无中生有荷栽培。 却因蛇女当时待，勾引郎君自外来。 两窍相通无隔碍，时宫聚会不分开。 翁然好合存无限，产个婴儿号圣胎。 九转大还 九转还丹下手功，要知山下出泉蒙。 安炉妙用凭坤土，运火功大藉巽风。 兑虎震龙才混合，坎男离女更和同。 自从四象归中后，造化机缄在我躬。 火候细微 年月日时攒一刻，一刻不刻阴阳别。 抽添符候兔鸡临，升降功夫龙虎烈。 虑险防危罢火功，称铢分两同爻策。 自然数足合周天，日日如斯行十月。 脱胎神化 丹成我命不由天，陵谷随他有变迁。 荣辱无干随处乐，利名不挂遂时颠。 但知壶内乾坤景，谁记人间甲子年！
chunks.translated_text:
**Postnatal Refinement of the Self**

Who knows the work of refining the self?
The numinous ever attends me.
Not a speck of dust stains the heart—all is still,
ten thousand cares forgotten—nature like a fool’s.

No demon dares invade the inner realm,
the disciple all day serves the stern master.
Hungry, I drink the wine of immortality,
daily drunk as mud, yet never sated.

**Refining the Self to Obtain the Medicine**

Refining the self follows foundation-building,
ten thousand cares at heart already forgotten.
A single moon’s glow keeps me company,
the thunder’s roar at midnight—only I know.

Snowflakes in stillness fly as white specks,
sprouts from emptiness grow as golden branches.
Seizing the yang qi, it returns to conceive—
giving birth to a thousand-year child who rides the crane.

**Commencing the Refinement of the Self**

Body apart, spirit communes—principle most clear.
The two hands must correspond in their work.
Set the furnace, erect the crucible, seek the true seed,
face the world without passion, recognize the native land.

Seize the dragon’s head to gather the purple mist,
split the tiger’s tail to reveal the golden light.
A speck of true lead swallowed into the belly—
all things shine, life endures long.

**The Primal Crucible**

Once the primal aperture is discerned,
the crucible of heaven and earth is known.
No need for spiritual effort to regulate water and fire—
naturally, the numinous qi permeates skin and flesh.

Morning by morning, the yellow crane hides in the golden crucible,
night by night, the silver toad pours into the jade pot.
To grasp the truth of the golden elixir,
practice where the body has not yet been born.

**The Primal True Lead**

All the world loves to enter the mystery,
yet none recognize this primal lead.
Within five thousand days, the yellow path is born,
in thirty hours, the black lead is known.

Not after heaven and earth were divided,
but before father and mother conceived.
This supreme treasure exists in every home—
only fools fail to see it clearly.

**The Primal Great Medicine**

Trust in the golden elixir—its principle most subtle,
this primal speck few understand.
Not bound by wealth or poverty, it exists in every home,
not limited by wisdom or folly, it grows in all.

Swallowed into the belly, it takes root,
held in the palm, it vanishes without form.
If the world asks me, I cannot answer—
I point afar to the moon rising at *geng*.

**Seizing the Primal**

I smile to see the wondrous mystery in this land,
whispered secrets passed close to the ear.
Split open chaos to seek the gold and mercury,
cleave the primal flood to grasp the watery lead.

A grain of millet holds the northern sea,
the toad’s ten thousand rays illuminate the western river.
If one gathers and swallows it into the belly,
how can a mortal not become immortal?

**Congealing the Primal**

Once the golden elixir is known, act at once—
its marvel lies in this subtle essence.
At the Gate of the Female, a speck of true lead stirs,
at the Mysterious Door, the three families form the foundation of creation.

Congealed in the Cinnabar Field, jade leaves grow,
returned to the earthen crucible, immortal fungi flourish.
If one wishes to grasp the primal principle,
recognize the red flower atop the black turtle.

**Recognizing and Gathering the Medicine**

The sun at the mountain’s peak, the moon in the sea’s depths,
at the assembly on Spirit Mountain, seek the eggplant’s hue.
Flowers bloom, birds sing—spring fills the day,
inverted dragon’s saliva paired with tiger’s blood.

Divine light pierces the Jade Pot Field,
the secret tally of *kun*, *shen*, *zi*, *wu* observed.
The blade’s master completes the great elixir in a hundred days—
once achieved, one becomes a wanderer of Penglai.

**Direct Indication of True Lead**

True lead is the flower of the moon,
west and north engender each other, one family.
Within the female lies the male—a treasure of power,
from black comes white—the numinous sprout appears.

Gold abundant, water scarce—this is precious,
yin flourishing, yang weak—nothing to boast.
Know too that it contains *wu* earth—
hour by hour, the furnace’s fire stirs cinnabar.

**Direct Indication of True Mercury**

True mercury is the essence of the sun,
east three, south two—white engenders white.
Fire hidden in wood is no idle tale,
the male embracing the female is the precious treasure.

Let not a speck of yin turbidity stain it,
ensure the whole body shines with the great yang.
Within it, *ji* earth nurtures the primal qi—
refined, the numinous sprout gradually grows.

**Lead and Mercury in Union**

True lead and true mercury unite,
like lacquer and glue, their bond unending.
Mercury poured into lead is like bathing the sun,
lead tempering mercury is like adding oil.

Lead harmonizes mercury’s nature, ever near,
mercury delights in lead’s affection, joyfully swimming.
The five phases within and without gather in array—
forming the red-and-white head of the great elixir.

**The Wondrous Use of Inversion**

Seeking truth and visiting the Dao—what difficulty?
Only that the human heart must know inversion.
Do not seek the supreme medicine in mountains and forests,
one must find true lead within the city.

The Green Dragon locks *li* and *kan* in union,
the White Tiger draws *dui* into *qian*.
This art follows as he departs—
naturally, one walks the path with heaven at their back.

**Harmonizing the Elixir Head**

Once the yellow path is born, *hai* begins,
true yang must return in accord with the season.
The samadhi fire issues from the *li* position,
a thunderclap resounds from the *zhen* palace.

Qi and spirit harmonize to nurture the numinous essence,
heart and life depend on each other to form the sacred embryo.
Once the inner message is grasped,
the three passes and nine apertures open at once.

**The Three Families Meet**

Invite the Yellow Dame to act as matchmaker,
from nothing, something is cultivated.
Because the Serpent Maiden waited at that time,
she lured the Young Lord from without.

The two apertures communicate without obstruction,
the hours and palaces gather without parting.
Suddenly, they unite in boundless harmony—
giving birth to an infant called the Sacred Embryo.

**The Great Return of Nine Cycles**

The nine-cycle returning elixir begins with practice—
know that beneath the mountain, the spring is obscure.
Setting the furnace relies on *kun* earth,
wielding the fire depends on *xun* wind.

*Dui* tiger and *zhen* dragon blend,
*kan* man and *li* woman harmonize further.
Once the four images return to the center,
the mechanism of creation rests within me.

**The Subtlety of Fire Timing**

Years, months, days, hours gather in a single moment—
a moment’s lapse and yin and yang diverge.
Withdrawing and adding follow the hare and rooster,
the work of ascent and descent—dragon and tiger fierce.

Guard against danger, cease the fire in time,
weigh each grain, measure each ounce like divining stalks.
Naturally, the count completes the celestial cycle—
daily thus, practice for ten months.

**Spiritual Transformation After Birth**

The elixir complete, my life obeys no heaven,
mountains and valleys may shift—what care I?
Honor and disgrace touch me not—I delight everywhere,
profit and fame cling not—I follow the moment’s whim.

I know only the scene within the pot—heaven and earth,
who remembers the years of the human world?

**Postnatal Foundation-Building**

Qi decayed, blood depleted—time to mend;
the enlightened master imparts the oral secret.
Jade fluid from the Flower Pool, swallow with the hours,
peach-blossom nectar, sip with the days.

Abandon thought, forget worry—return to the child’s heart,
root and life restored—immortal’s work.
The Cinnabar Field warms, the face regains youth,
mocking those who cling to empty heads of snow.

chunks.original_text: 欲问归踪何处是，醉中遥指白云边。 面壁九年 九年面壁养神体，默默昏昏如炼己。 无束无拘得自由，随缘随分能知止。 心同日月大辉光，我与乾坤为表里。 打破虚空不等闲，收拾六合一黍米。 换鼎分胎 重安炉鼎立坤乾，巧手移丹入上田。 道德崇高神益迈，虚空粉碎法无边。 从今易舍还成质，以后分胎又入玄。 儿养孙兮孙养子，老翁老母一齐仙。 转制通灵 养得玄孙渐长成，强宗胜祖善谋营。 昨宵灯下逢佳偶，今日堂前产俊英。 个个孩儿森玉树，飘飘仙嗣簇金茎。 一班胜似连城壁，无税良田只自耕。 九转灵变 九转丹砂岁月深，养成舍利鬼神钦。 一炉白雪浑如玉，满鼎黄芽胜似金。 曾见鸾飞和凤舞，但看虎啸与龙吟。 五金八石皆成宝，还炼天元拔宅升。 修炼天元 天元丹品问谁知，有自无生世所稀。 天地为炉真造化，阴阳作药自玄微。 鸡餐变鹤青云去，犬食成龙白昼飞。 到此方称高妙极，许君携手一同归。 潇洒悠游 道人久已泯耳目，潇洒自如脱拘束。 朝从扶桑日头起，暮去昆仑云脚宿。 青牛过关知几年，此道分明在眼前。 昨夜瑶琴三叠后，一天风冷月娟娟。 了道度人 铁笛双吹破晓烟，相逢又隔几多年。 曾将物外无为事，付在毫端不尽传。 白发数茎君已老！ 青云几度我当先？ 世间穷究只加此，何若同游归洞天。 总咏内事 清净身心修内药，栽培气血返童姿。 借他铅鼎寻真种，点我凡躯入圣基。 十月怀胎加漫火，九年面壁养灵儿。 嫦娥最爱儿年少，夜夜笙歌宴玉池。 总咏外事 真铅真汞结夫妻，两意交欢产个儿。 幼子成人离祖业，玄孙主事建新基。 恢宏家道成三业，大展门庭第九枝。 满室堆金何足羡，但看拨宅住瑶池。 咏先天鼎 二七谁家女？ 眉端彩色光。 人皆贪爱欲，我看是亲娘。 一点灵丹透，浑身粉汗香。 霉时干我汞，换骨作纯阳。 金丹诗二十四首 采取先天炼后天，循环二气共根源。 欲知有象原无象，须识初弦与下弦。 杳杳乾坤将判处，冥冥父母末生前。 服之混沌犹如梦，变化婴儿寿万年。 月本无光借日光，每从晦朔定阴阳。 蟾乌交媾合真质，牛女相期入杳茫。 自是魂灵应魄圣，从他地久与天长。 学人解得玄中妙，紫府高悬姓字香。 七日阳来下鹊桥，上桥夫妇任逍遥。 逆回海水流天谷，倒转风帆运斗构。 手握乾坤分造化，时凭年月步周遭。 神仙手段常如此，那与庸夫斗舌苗！ 橐龠吹嘘藉巽风，搬来坤火自鸿氵蒙。 徐徐摄上昆仑顶，渐渐吞问土釜宫。 铅汞相投成至宝，精神凝合变婴童。 将来跳出乾坤外，不属璇玑造化中。 安炉立鼎炼金丹，水怕干兮火怕寒。 既未锻时常守护，屯蒙行处要勤看。 抽铅添汞须加紧，虑险防危奥放宽。 毫发差殊功不就。 半途而废复行难。 龙升虎降转河车，赤火擒采制白砂。 二气凝胎铅自减，三花聚顶汞还加。 开炉漫搅成钟乳，起鼎应知是马牙。 两物齐拿休纵放，放之失却美金花。 采回坤地水金多，种在乾家入爱河。 阳火阴符依进退，铅龙汞虎自调和。 浆收东位成甘露，酒饮西方醉绮罗。 但要至诚勤爱护，胎圆十月化青娥。 夺得乾坤一点精，阴阳交媾自然成。 夫妻会合攒三姓，戊己交加簇五行。 朔望屯蒙鸡兔跃，晦弦既未虎龙争。 地天收在玄关机运转河车霹雳声。 身中水火即阴阳，二气相孚化紫光。
chunks.translated_text:
**Inquiry of the Returning Trace**

Should you ask where the returning trace lies,
drunk, I point afar to the edge of white clouds.

**Facing the Wall for Nine Years**

Nine years facing the wall to nurture the spirit-body,
silent and dim as refining the self.
Unbound, unconstrained—freedom attained,
following conditions, knowing when to cease.
The heart shines vast as sun and moon,
I and heaven-and-earth form inner and outer.
Shattering emptiness is no trifling matter,
gathering the six directions into a millet grain.

**Changing the Cauldron and Parting the Embryo**

Reinstalling the furnace and cauldron, establishing kun and qian,
with skillful hands, the elixir is moved into the upper field.
Virtue and power ascend—spirit grows ever more transcendent,
emptiness crumbles—dharma knows no bounds.
From now on, the coarse is shed and essence restored,
hereafter, the embryo parts and enters the mysterious.
Children nurture grandchildren, grandchildren nurture sons,
old man and old woman—all ascend as immortals.

**Transforming and Communing with the Numinous**

Nurturing the mysterious grandson until he gradually matures,
a strong lineage surpasses its ancestors in wise planning.
Last night beneath the lamp, a fine match was made,
today in the hall, a brilliant scion is born.
Each child stands like a jade tree,
their immortal descendants cluster like golden stalks.
A company surpassing linked jade disks,
tax-free fertile fields—self-cultivated alone.

**Ninefold Spiritual Transformation**

Ninefold cinnabar elixir—years deepen,
nurturing śarīra that gods and ghosts revere.
A furnace of white snow, pure as jade,
a cauldron of yellow sprouts, finer than gold.
Once seen, phoenixes dance with simurghs,
now behold tigers roaring and dragons chanting.
The five metals and eight minerals all become treasures,
refining the celestial origin to ascend with one’s dwelling.

**Cultivating the Celestial Origin**

Who knows the celestial origin’s elixir grade?
Born from non-being—rare in the world.
Heaven and earth serve as the furnace—true creation,
yin and yang as the medicine—subtle and profound.
The chicken that eats transforms into a crane, soaring through blue clouds,
the dog that feeds becomes a dragon, flying in broad daylight.
Only here is the ultimate subtlety attained,
permitting you to join hands and return together.

**Carefree and Unfettered**

The Daoist long since dissolved ears and eyes,
carefree and unconstrained, free from bonds.
At dawn, rising with the sun at Fusang,
at dusk, lodging at Kunlun’s cloud feet.
How many years since the green ox crossed the pass?
This Dao lies clearly before your eyes.
Last night, after three refrains of the jade zither,
the wind chilled the sky, the moon shone bright.

**Attaining the Dao and Delivering Others**

Twin iron flutes blow through the dawn mist,
meeting again after how many years?
Once, the affairs beyond things—non-action—
were entrusted to the brush’s tip, never fully conveyed.
A few white hairs—you’ve grown old!
How many times have I ascended the blue clouds?
In the world, exhaustive inquiry leads only here—
why not wander together back to the grotto-heaven?

**General Ode to Inner Work**

Purify body and mind to refine the inner medicine,
cultivate qi and blood to restore youthful countenance.
Borrowing the lead cauldron to seek the true seed,
transmuting this mortal frame into sagely foundation.
Ten months’ gestation with gentle fire,
nine years facing the wall to nurture the spirit-child.
Chang’e most adores the youthful,
nightly feasting with songs by the Jade Pool.

**General Ode to Outer Work**

True lead and true mercury unite as husband and wife,
their mutual joy produces a child.
The young son matures and leaves the ancestral estate,
the mysterious grandson takes charge, building new foundations.
Expanding the family’s path into three enterprises,
greatly flourishing the household’s ninth branch.
A room piled with gold—what is there to envy?
Behold the entire household dwelling in the Jasper Pool.

**Ode to the Prior-Heaven Cauldron**

Whose daughter is this fourteen-year-old?
Her brow radiates colorful light.
All crave love and desire,
I see her as my true mother.
A speck of numinous elixir penetrates,
her whole body exudes fragrant sweat.
In an instant, she dries my mercury,
changing my bones into pure yang.

**Twenty-Four Poems on the Golden Elixir**

Gathering prior-heaven to refine the posterior-heaven,
the two qi circulate from a shared root.
To know the formed as originally formless,
one must recognize the first and last crescents.
Vast and indistinct—where heaven and earth divide,
dim and obscure—before father and mother were born.
Consuming it, chaos remains like a dream,
transforming into an infant with ten thousand years of life.

The moon itself has no light—it borrows the sun’s,
each month from new to full, yin and yang are fixed.
Toad and crow unite in true essence,
Oxherd and Weaver Girl meet in the distant haze.
Naturally, the soul responds to the sacred spirit,
while heaven and earth endure.
If the adept grasps the mystery within,
their name and fame hang high in the Purple Palace.

Seven days of yang descend the magpie bridge,
ascending the bridge, the couple roams freely.
Reversing the sea’s waters to flow into the celestial valley,
inverting the sail to navigate the Dipper’s frame.
Hands grasp heaven and earth, dividing creation,
timed by years and months, pacing the celestial circuit.
Such are the immortal’s arts—always thus,
not to contend with the vulgar in idle debate!

The bellows blow, aided by the xun wind,
drawing kun’s fire from the primordial flood.
Gently lifting it to Kunlun’s summit,
gradually swallowing it into the earthen cauldron’s palace.
Lead and mercury unite to form the supreme treasure,
spirit and essence congeal into an infant.
Thus leaping beyond heaven and earth,
no longer bound by the turning celestial sphere.

Establishing the furnace, setting the cauldron to refine the golden elixir,
water fears drying, fire fears cold.
Before forging, guard it constantly,
at the stages of *zhun* and *meng*, observe diligently.
Withdrawing lead, adding mercury—be vigilant,
guard against danger, relax the profound.
A hair’s difference and the work fails,
abandoning halfway makes resumption difficult.

Dragon ascends, tiger descends—turning the river chariot,
red fire seizes and refines the white sand.
The two qi congeal the embryo—lead naturally diminishes,
the three flowers gather at the crown—mercury returns and increases.
Opening the furnace, stir it gently to form stalactites,
raising the cauldron, know it as horse’s teeth.
Grasp both substances—do not let them escape,
releasing them loses the golden flower’s beauty.

Gathering from kun’s earth where water and metal abound,
planting in qian’s domain, entering the river of love.
Yang fire and yin tally follow advance and retreat,
lead dragon and mercury tiger naturally harmonize.
Nectar gathers in the east to form sweet dew,
wine drunk in the west intoxicates with brocade.
Only with utmost sincerity and diligent care,
the embryo rounds in ten months, transforming into the azure maiden.

Seizing a speck of heaven and earth’s essence,
yin and yang unite naturally.
Husband and wife converge, gathering the three clans,
wu and ji intersect, clustering the five phases.
New and full—*zhun* and *meng*—hare and rooster leap,
dark and crescent—tiger and dragon contend.
Heaven and earth are gathered in the mysterious pass,
the river chariot turns with thunderous sound.

The body’s water and fire are yin and yang,
the two qi mutually embrace, transforming into purple light.

**Spiritual Transformation After Birth**

The elixir complete, my life obeys no heaven,
mountains and valleys may shift—what care I?
Honor and disgrace touch me not—I delight everywhere,
profit and fame cling not—I follow the moment’s whim.

I know only the scene within the pot—heaven and earth,
who remembers the years of the human world?

chunks.original_text: 日日醍醐延命酒，时时吞咽返魂浆。 玄机不许庸人识，大药须令志士尝。 九转功完还太始，坤柔炼尽变乾刚。 火性炎炎水性流，河车搬运自然周。 昆仑片玉原无价，沧海明珠竟暗投。 三昧初从离下发，一符始自坎中浮。 自家消息谁能会？ 莫向人前插话头。 修仙须要修天仙，金液神丹仔细看。 添在离宫抽在坎，寄于兑位种于乾。 死生了当非神气，性命功夫在汞铅。 世上纷纷谈道者，凡人于此达真诠？ 炼已寻真固不难，先擒兔髓配乌肝。 牵龙就虎归根窍，制汞投铅复命关。 金气往来通夹脊，河车搬运上泥丸。 夫妻共入黄婆舍，火候调停自结丹。 阖辟乾坤橐龠形，屯蒙呼吸坎离精。 鼎和四象真铅降，炉备三才妙汞生。 一有两无同变化，两无一有共相成。 时人要识玄中妙，配合青娥仔细论。 中宫戊己自知音，二物媒来共一心。 姹女用吹无孔笛，金公为抱没弦琴。 深深密密谁能测？ 杳杳冥冥孰解寻？ 指日还丹成就后，总教大地尽黄金。 温温铅鼎透帘帏，认定人身活子时。 虎啸一声忙采取，龙吟初敕急施为。 守城野战天翻地，入室防危坎复离。 夺得团团龟凤髓，请君服食赴瑶池。 入室虚心炼大丹，神功妙用不为难。 能窥天巧参元气，解饮刀圭夺紫丸。 朔望符来三姓合，晦弦火退五行攒。 羿妇纵会奔蟾窟，争似青娥驾彩鸾。 木中砂汞水中金，漫向离宫坎位寻。 只就乾坤分主客，还依龙虎定浮沉。 故能金木成三姓，遂使夫妻共一心。 庭院归来相聚会，黄婆媒灼是知音。 真炉真鼎发真机，采药须凭亥尽时。 铅母氤氲光欲动，金胎跳跃火临期。 休忘气候调真息，但守虚无运坎离。 临阵莫教轻纵敌，兢兢业业更防危。 十月功完造化坚，若加火候必伤丹。 仙房气血浑忘却，宝鼎金炉不用看。 面壁九年形脱壳，身超三界体生翰。 只缘黍米吞归腹，衍满功成跨凤鸾。 上吞下啖两弦弦。 逐节堤防入玉田。 往往来来宾返主，未夫妇妇倒和颠。 结丹已喜婴儿兆，出壳皆凭圣母全。 远近熬游看四正，东西南北任周旋。 韬光晦迹隐红尘，有作谁知妙更真。 伏虎降龙须混俗，超凡入圣乃惊人。 深深秘秘修丹道，白白明明显至神。 《药镜》玄机俱泄尽，古今山此达天津。 《金碧》《参同》及《指玄》，《翠虚》性命与忠仙。 《阴符》宝字逾三百，《道德》灵文贯五千。 《入药镜》中推橐龠，《悟真篇》内究蹄筌。 金丹切近叮咛语，总论前弦与后弦。 火候功夫本自然，能通此妙即神仙。 五行攒簇盗天地，八卦循环作圣贤。 造化炉中烹日月，乾坤鼎内产金莲。 有人识得精微理，随我飞升朝帝前。 虔诚稽首拜星君，顶礼星辰护本身。 二十八宿齐朗耀，三百六度尽分陈。 上圣能攒年月日，中宫保合气精神。 照临应许增遇寿，掩映还同二曜新。 大丹诗八首书武当道室示诸弟子 学道修真出世尘，遨游云水乐天真。 身中灵药非金石，腹内神砂岂水银！ 采炼功夫依日月，烹煎火候配庚卒。 黄婆媒娉三家合，饮酒观花遍地春。 采聚他家一味铅，捉精炼气补先天。 前弦八两后弦八，内药还时外药还。 紫府玄宫垂宝露，黄芽白雪化金蟾。 神仙妙用常如此，火里能栽九节莲。 初关中关与后关，下田中田与上田。 层次原来分井井，火功须要法乾乾。
chunks.translated_text:
Daily, the ambrosial wine of life-extension is drunk,
hourly, the soul-returning nectar is swallowed.
The mystery is not for mediocre minds to know,
the great elixir must be tasted by the resolute.
Nine cycles complete, returning to the Great Beginning,
earth’s softness refined to heaven’s hardness.
Fire’s nature blazes, water’s nature flows,
the river chariot’s transport naturally cycles.

A piece of Kunlun jade is priceless,
a bright pearl of the vast sea cast in darkness.
Samādhi first arises from *li* below,
a single talisman first floats from *kan* within.
Who can grasp one’s own subtle signs?
Never speak of this before others.

To cultivate immortality, one must cultivate the celestial immortal,
observe closely the divine elixir of golden liquid.
Added in the *li* palace, drawn from *kan*,
lodged in *dui*, planted in *qian*.
Life and death are settled not by spirit or qi,
but by the work on mercury and lead in nature and destiny.

Those in the world who chatter of the Dao—
can common folk grasp this true essence?
Refining the self to seek the real is not difficult,
first capture the hare’s marrow to pair with the crow’s liver.
Lead the dragon to the tiger, returning to the root cavity,
restrain mercury, cast lead, reviving the gate of life.

Golden qi comes and goes through the spine,
the river chariot transports upward to the mud-pill palace.
Husband and wife enter the Yellow Dame’s abode together,
fire and timing harmonized, the elixir naturally forms.
Opening and closing, the bellows shape of heaven and earth,
*zhun* and *meng* breathe the essence of *kan* and *li*.

The crucible harmonizes the four images, true lead descends,
the furnace prepares the three talents, wondrous mercury arises.
One has, two have not—together they transform,
two have not, one has—together they complete.
If one wishes to know the marvel within the mystery,
discuss carefully with the azure maiden.

The central palace’s *wu* and *ji* know their own resonance,
two substances, the matchmaker brings them to one heart.
The maiden blows the flute without holes,
the golden lord holds the zither without strings.
Who can fathom such depth and secrecy?
Who can seek such profound obscurity?

On the day the returning elixir is accomplished,
all the earth shall be turned to gold.
The gentle lead cauldron permeates the curtains,
recognize the living *zi* hour within the body.
At the tiger’s roar, swiftly gather,
at the dragon’s first cry, urgently act.

Defend the city, wage wild battle—heaven and earth overturn,
enter the chamber, guard against danger—*kan* and *li* alternate.
Seizing the round marrow of tortoise and phoenix,
I invite you to consume it and ascend to Jasper Pool.

Enter the chamber with an empty mind to refine the great elixir,
the divine work’s wondrous use is not difficult.
Able to perceive heaven’s craft and partake of primordial qi,
knowing how to drink the *daogui* and seize the purple pill.
At new and full moon, the talisman arrives, the three clans unite,
at dark and crescent, the fire retreats, the five phases cluster.

Even if Yi’s wife could rush to the moon’s cave,
how could she compare to the azure maiden riding the colored phoenix?
Mercury in wood, gold in water—
do not vainly seek in the *li* palace or *kan* position.
Only by distinguishing host and guest in *qian* and *kun*,
and following dragon and tiger to determine ascent and descent,
can metal and wood form the three clans,
and husband and wife unite as one heart.

Returning to the courtyard, they gather in meeting,
the Yellow Dame, the matchmaker, is the confidant.
The true furnace, true crucible reveal the true mechanism,
gathering the medicine must rely on the hour when *hai* ends.
The lead mother’s misty radiance stirs,
the golden embryo leaps as fire approaches.
Do not forget to regulate the breath with true rhythm,
only guard emptiness and move *kan* and *li*.

On the battlefield, do not lightly release the enemy,
be vigilant and cautious, ever guarding against danger.
Ten months’ work complete, creation is firm—
if fire and timing are added, the elixir will surely be harmed.
The immortal’s chamber forgets qi and blood,
the treasure tripod and golden furnace need not be watched.
Facing the wall for nine years, the form sheds its shell,
the body transcends the three realms, the essence grows wings.

Only because the millet grain was swallowed and returned to the belly,
the work overflows, completed, riding the phoenix and simurgh.
Above swallowing, below gulping—both strings,
step by step, guard and enter the jade field.
Coming and going, guest returns as host,
unhusbanded wife and unwifed husband reverse and harmonize.
Forming the elixir, the infant’s omen is joyful,
emerging from the shell relies entirely on the holy mother.

Roaming near and far, observe the four directions,
east and west, south and north, move freely.
Concealing light, obscuring traces, hidden in the red dust,
with action, who knows the wonder is even more real?
Taming the tiger, subduing the dragon, one must blend with the world,
transcending the ordinary, entering the sacred, then astonishing others.

Deeply secret, secretly refining the elixir path,
brightly clear, clearly manifesting the divine.
*The Mirror of Medicines* reveals all mysteries,
from ancient times to now, mountains reach the celestial ford.
*The Golden Green*, *Triplex Unity*, and *Pointing to the Mystery*,
*The Emerald Void*—nature, destiny, loyalty, and immortality.
*The Treasure of the Yin Talisman* surpasses three hundred characters,
*The Scripture of Dao and Virtue*’s numinous text spans five thousand.
In *The Mirror of Entering Medicines*, the bellows is expounded,
in *The Awakening to Reality*, the hoof and fish trap are explored.

The golden elixir’s urgent admonitions,
all discuss the prior and posterior strings.
The work of fire and timing is fundamentally natural—
able to penetrate this marvel is to be an immortal.
The five phases cluster, stealing heaven and earth,
the eight trigrams cycle, becoming sages and worthies.
In the crucible of creation, the sun and moon are refined,
in the cauldron of heaven and earth, the golden lotus is born.

If one knows the subtle principle,
follow me to ascend and pay homage before the Emperor.
Reverently bow to the star lords,
prostrate to the stars and constellations, protecting this body.
The twenty-eight lunar mansions shine brightly,
the three hundred sixty degrees are all arrayed.

The highest sages can gather years, months, and days,
the central palace preserves and unites qi and spirit.
Illuminating and granting increased longevity,
obscuring and renewing like the two luminaries.

**Eight Poems on the Great Elixir, Written in the Wudang Daoist Chamber for Disciples**

To study the Dao and refine the real is to leave the worldly dust,
roaming clouds and waters, delighting in celestial truth.
The numinous medicine within the body is not metal or stone,
the divine cinnabar in the belly is not mercury!
The work of gathering and refining follows the sun and moon,
the fire and timing of decoction match *geng* and *zu*.
The Yellow Dame, the matchmaker, unites the three families,
drinking wine, viewing flowers—spring fills the earth.

Gather the lead from another’s home,
seize essence, refine qi, replenishing the prior heaven.
Eight ounces before the string, eight ounces after,
the inner medicine returns when the outer medicine returns.
The purple palace and mysterious palace drip precious dew,
yellow sprouts and white snow transform into the golden toad.
The immortal’s wondrous use is ever thus—
in fire, one can plant the nine-jointed lotus.

The initial barrier, middle barrier, and final barrier,
lower field, middle field, and upper field.
The layers were originally distinct and orderly,
the fire’s work must follow the *qian* method.
