chunks.original_text: 室窗透亮三更到，昼夜通红九鼎全。 文武阴阳勤转炼，辟开万窍好朝天。 身内功夫我自知，天机玄妙有谁窥？ 初寻龙虎来争战，又见龟蛇喜唱随。 天地倒颠观否泰，火符起止在虚危。 南辰北斗映前后，日月乌蟾来往飞。 修真大道乾坤祖，采取阴阳造化功。 要制天魂生白虎，须擒地魄产青龙。 运回至宝归中合，变化阳神入上宫。 一气凝成丹一粒，人能吞服貌如童。 道法傍门有万千，不知火候总徒然。 先穷妙理将真悟，后拜明师把诀传。 欲使三家情意合，只凭一点道心坚。 朝钥锻炼精神杰，结就真神上九天。 寻真要识虚无窍，功夫只在意所到。 往来顺逆炼阴阳； 升降坎离在颠倒。 恍恍惚惚太极生，杳杳冥冥婴儿兆。 出玄入牝由自然，若忘若存守坛灶。 知先达后炼金丹，火冷水干做不全。 上德无为成至圣，下功有作在周天。 一阳动处窥天地，二品合时生佛仙。 月里栽花无片晌，蟾光现出照西川。 琼花诗 琼枝玉树属仙家，未识人间有此花。 清致不沾凡雨露，高标长带古烟霞。 历年既久何曾老，举世无双莫浪夸。 几欲载回天上去，拟从博望借灵槎。 七绝五首 真心浩浩无穷极，无限神仙从里出。 世人耽着小形骸，一颗玄珠人不识！ 佛印指出虚而觉，丹阳诀破无中有。 捉住元初那点真，万古千秋身不朽。 溯流一直上蓬莱，散布甘泉润九垓。 从此丹田沾润泽，黄芽遍地一齐开。 年月日时空有着，卦爻斤两亦支离。 若曾会得绵绵意，正是勿忘勿助时。 大药无多只一丸，须求同类两相欢。 世人欲问长生诀，先觅阴阳二品丹。 登高台 金丹造化妙难言，玄微道理谁分辨！ 幸遇明师指，抉破水中天。 先教咱守定玄关，盘膝坐凋神理气，除思虑塞兑垂帘。 次教咱鼓动巽风，搬运水火，守固真精，保定元阳，拨转天关。 又只见，黄河水滔滔逆流，从涌泉，灌尾闾，至夹脊，升上泥丸。 过明堂，大华池，神水渐涨，下重楼，入绛宫，直至丹田。 这才是筑基炼己，从今后住世延年。 更欲求，最上乘飞升道理，还教咱重安炉，复立鼎，采取先天配后天。 遇子午专行火候，逢卯酉沐浴金丹。 再教咱先明天地机，次把阴阳辨。 有天先有母，无母亦无天，这才是大道根源。 把周天从头数，将乾坤颠倒安。 采后天殷勤玉炼，夺先天成圣成仙。 我已曾拜明师，心心相授，口口相传。 筑基时先明橐龠，炼巳时只用真铅。 坎中满离中之物，离中虚取坎还填。 逆成仙龙吞虎髓。 顺成人虎夺龙涎。 喜的是木龙藏汞，爱的是金虎吐铅。 月之圆存乎口诀，时之子妙在心传。 采先天之功，全凭戊己； 夺后天之杰，龙虎初弦。 青龙白虎相争战，玉兔金马一处转。 防只防身中无慧剑，怕只怕急水滩头挽不住船，等只等黄婆勾引，候只候少女开莲。 此事难言，五千日内君须算，三十时辰暗里盘。 子前午后分明看，铅阳未动，癸现于前，真铅真阳随后边。 药到临炉，此时休怠慢，急速下手擒入关，随后用六百抽添。 十月胎圆，婴儿出现，面壁九年，独露真诠，才做个阆苑蓬莱物外仙。 天仙引五首 第一体
chunks.translated_text:
The chamber’s windows glow bright by the third watch,
day and night ablaze, the nine cauldrons complete.
With civil and martial, yin and yang, diligently refine,
cleaving open ten thousand apertures to face the heavens.
The work within the body I alone know—
who has glimpsed the celestial mechanism’s profound mystery?
First, seek the Dragon and Tiger locked in battle,
then behold the Tortoise and Snake joyfully following in song.
Heaven and earth inverted, observing *pi* and *tai*,
fire talismans rise and cease in *xu* and *wei*.
South Star and North Dipper mirror front and back,
sun and moon, Crow and Toad, fly to and fro.

The great Dao of cultivation is the ancestor of heaven and earth,
gathering yin and yang to forge the work of creation.
To subdue the celestial soul and birth the White Tiger,
one must capture the earthly spirit to produce the Azure Dragon.
Circulate the supreme treasure to the central confluence,
transforming the yang spirit to ascend the upper palace.
A single *qi* condenses into one grain of elixir—
if one can swallow it, their countenance becomes youthful.

A thousand side paths branch from the Dao,
but without knowing the fire’s timing, all is in vain.
First delve into the wondrous principle to truly awaken,
then bow to an enlightened master to receive the oral transmission.
To unite the three families in harmony,
rely solely on the steadfastness of the Dao-heart.
Morning and evening, forge and temper the spirit’s brilliance,
condensing the true spirit to ascend the nine heavens.

Seeking the true requires recognizing the Void’s aperture—
the work lies only where intention arrives.
Coming and going, reversing and following, refine yin and yang;
rising and descending, *kan* and *li* invert.
Vaguely, indistinctly, the Supreme Ultimate arises,
dimly, obscurely, the Infant’s omen appears.
Exiting the mysterious, entering the feminine, all is natural—
as if forgotten, as if preserved, guarding the furnace and hearth.

Knowing the prior to refine the Golden Elixir,
if the fire cools or water dries, the work is incomplete.
Supreme virtue, non-action, perfects the sage,
while lesser efforts, with action, circulate the *zhou tian*.
At the stirring of the first yang, heaven and earth are revealed;
when the two grades unite, Buddhas and immortals are born.
Planting flowers in the moon lasts but a fleeting moment,
yet the Toad’s radiance emerges, illuminating the western river.

**Jade Flower Poem**
Jade branches and trees belong to the immortals’ realm—
who in the mortal world has seen such a flower?
Its pure essence untouched by common rain and dew,
its lofty bearing ever veiled in ancient mist and rosy clouds.
Though ages pass, it never ages,
peerless in the world—let none boast idly.
I would carry it back to heaven,
planning to borrow the Magpie Bridge from *Bowang*.

**Five Seven-Character Quatrains**
The true heart, vast and boundless,
gives rise to limitless immortals within.
Mortals cling to their petty forms—
who recognizes the single grain of mysterious pearl?

The Buddha’s seal points to emptiness as awakening,
Danyang’s secret breaks open nothingness to reveal being.
Seize the original, primal spark—
through ten thousand ages, the body never decays.

Tracing the current straight to Penglai,
scattering sweet springs to moisten the nine realms.
From this, the cinnabar field is nourished,
and yellow sprouts bloom everywhere at once.

Years, months, days, and hours are but empty markers,
hexagrams, lines, ounces, and taels are but fragments.
If you have grasped the ceaseless intent,
this is precisely the time of "neither forgetting nor assisting."

The great medicine is but a single pill—
seek its kindred pair to rejoice together.
If mortals ask for the secret of longevity,
first seek the dual elixirs of yin and yang.

**Ascending the High Terrace**
The wonders of the Golden Elixir’s creation are hard to express,
who can discern the subtle principles of the mysterious?
Fortunately, I met an enlightened master who pointed the way,
prying open the sky within the water.

First, he taught me to guard the mysterious pass,
cross-legged, sitting to harmonize spirit, principle, and *qi*,
banishing thoughts, sealing the senses, lowering the lids.
Next, he taught me to stir the *xun* wind,
circulating water and fire,
guarding the true essence,
preserving the original yang,
turning the celestial pivot.

Then I saw the Yellow River’s waters surging in reverse,
flowing from *yongquan*,
irrigating *weilu*,
ascending *jiaji* to reach *niwan*.
Passing the Hall of Light and the Great Flower Pool,
the divine water gradually swelled,
descending the Tower of Nine Stories,
entering the Crimson Palace,
until it reached the cinnabar field.
This is the foundation-laying and self-refinement—
henceforth, one abides in the world to extend years.

If one further seeks the supreme path of ascension,
the master teaches to reset the furnace,
reestablish the tripod,
gathering the prior heaven to match the posterior.
At *zi* and *wu*, focus on the fire’s timing,
at *mao* and *you*, bathe the Golden Elixir.
First, he taught me to understand the mechanism of heaven and earth,
then to distinguish yin and yang.
Heaven exists because of the Mother,
without the Mother, there is no heaven—
this is the root of the great Dao.
Count the *zhou tian* from the beginning,
invert *qian* and *kun* to set them right.
Diligently refine the posterior heaven’s *yin*,
seizing the prior heaven to become a sage or immortal.

I have already bowed to an enlightened master,
heart-to-heart transmission, mouth-to-mouth teaching.
When laying the foundation, first clarify the bellows and furnace,
when refining the self, use only true lead.
The fullness within *kan* and the emptiness within *li*—
*li*’s void takes from *kan* to replenish.
In reversal, the immortal dragon swallows the tiger’s marrow;
in sequence, the mortal tiger seizes the dragon’s saliva.
What delights is the Wood Dragon concealing mercury,
what is cherished is the Metal Tiger spitting lead.
The moon’s fullness depends on the oral formula,
the hour of *zi*’s wonder lies in heart transmission.
Gathering the prior heaven’s work relies entirely on *wu* and *ji*;
seizing the posterior heaven’s brilliance begins with the Dragon and Tiger at the new moon.
Azure Dragon and White Tiger battle,
Jade Hare and Golden Horse revolve as one.
Beware only of lacking the wisdom sword within,
fear only the rapids where the boat cannot be reined in.
Wait only for the Yellow Dame’s beckoning,
await only the Maiden’s lotus blossoming.

This matter is hard to speak of—
within five thousand days, you must calculate,
thirty *shi chen* secretly revolving.
Before *zi* and after *wu*, observe clearly:
lead yang has not stirred,
*gui* appears ahead,
true lead and true yang follow behind.
When the medicine arrives at the furnace,
do not be negligent—
swiftly seize it and draw it into the pass,
then apply the six hundred refinements.

After ten months, the embryo is complete,
the Infant appears,
facing the wall for nine years,
alone revealing the true canon—
only then does one become an immortal beyond Penglai and Kunlun.

chunks.translated_text:
Seeking heaven within earth,
hunting lightning amid clouds.
Moment by moment, rein in the mind-steed,
instant by instant, tether the heart-ape.
Day and night without sleep,
the work of refining the self knows no pause,
yet the resolve to hold the heart grows ever firmer.
Seal the Three Treasures deep within the abyss,
capture the Five Thieves without to gaze upon the celestial gardens.
Command self and other to rest in perfect stability,
make yin and yang invert and overturn.
Repel the demon hordes with the sword of wisdom,
gather the Black Tortoise’s first breath,
seize the White Tiger’s initial string.
Erect the Celestial Root,
suspend the Moon Cavern in emptiness.
Display divine powers by planting lotus in raging fire,
wield the craftsman’s hand to pole a boat on frail waters.
Sweep clean the heart to still the mind,
nurture essence to fullness, qi to wholeness.
No envy for lovely, seductive flowers—
only await the sweet path of nectar springs,
make the passionless shed their mortal guise.
Assault the Crimson Continent,
shatter the Scarlet County,
seize the Golden Essence and lead it carefully,
usher it into the cinnabar field.
Guard against peril, dispel stray thoughts,
stabilize the breath, calm the spirit, sever false ties.
Bathe and cleanse the heart, end the struggle—
the sacred embryo emerges unobstructed.
Facing the wall for nine years,
refining spirit to return to emptiness—
this is when our work is complete.

**Second Body**
Behold the *Returning to the Root and Restoring Life* chapter,
observe the *Nurturing Nature and Cultivating Truth* scroll.
Only then know water within metal,
only then recognize heaven within earth.
Cast aside the wondrous "&" character—
life and death are but a thread apart,
Dragon and Tiger lie hidden in the two strings.
Expound the mysterious *Gate of Dao and Virtue* immortal scriptures,
plumb the *Wuzhen* sagely canon of *Wuji*.
Discuss how metal is born in the *geng* direction,
speak of how medicine arises in the *dui* position,
point clearly to the Crimson Continent.
Like dew, like lightning,
like mist, like smoke—
only await the Black Tortoise’s exhalation,
the White Tiger’s spittle.
Slay the Three Corpses, extinguish demonic realms,
capture the Five Thieves, make the horse lie down and the ape sleep.
Pursue the divine hero into the Sea of Return,
circulate true qi to surge through the *Yongquan*,
gather golden essence and lodge it in the cinnabar field.
Naturally, it will penetrate through,
flowing through every joint of the body.
Heart like fire,
mind like lightning—
nurture the golden elixir,
mercury gradually increases, close the *dui* and forget speech.
Nine years facing the wall, work without cease,
the Supreme Ultimate wanders through the great thousand worlds,
the seven-times-returned Infant appears of itself.
The Six Thieves vanish,
the Five Phases complete their numbers,
the people of the four seas know to return to the Penglai gardens.

**Third Body**
First harmonize the breath,
then unite metal and wood.
Lead essence conceals itself in the transforming gate,
mercury fluid hides in the mysterious portal—
the root of creation.
In the profound darkness, there is a sign;
in the indistinct, nothing to see or hear.
Nurture the medicine sprout, ever keep the furnace whole,
pluck the yellow sprout, never let the crucible be damaged.
Ensure the original spirit does not stray from the square inch,
seek golden water to irrigate Kunlun.
Rely on the wisdom sword to pursue and press the demon hordes,
seal the Three Treasures, hold the heart and mind with care,
capture the Five Thieves, diligently refine the self.
Sever greed and wrath, dispel ten thousand cares,
encounter the passing scene without staining a single dust.
I only await—
on the winding river, the moon spitting forth *gengshen*,
in the mountain’s form, treading snow to seek spring.
Gather golden essence only when leaving the Crimson Waters,
harmonize true breath to circulate through the whole body,
circulate one’s own mercury to envelop yang essence.
The furnace fire ever warm,
hour by hour, moment by moment, advance with precision.
Like the foolish, like the dull,
sit in silence, forget speech,
guard poverty and preserve the whole truth.
I turn to the deep mountains, facing the wall where none inquire,
in the quiet chamber, with ashen heart, only I am intimate.
Regulate spirit and breath,
rely on our teachings—
not speaking of ten months’ gestation,
only nine years of toil,
today the work is complete, the merit full, only then is the original nature realized.

**Fourth Body**
Leisurely peruse the *Scripture of Dragon and Tiger*,
quietly contemplate the *Mirror of Entering the Medicine*—
originally, lead is but one flavor,
falsely given many names.
It lurks in the water’s depths,
bestowed upon the crown of *Xiyi*,
residing in the transforming pit.
Scarlet, it hides in sweet springs,
closely packed, it conceals itself in the cinnabar well.
I only await—
at the Winter Solstice, when the first yang stirs,
at the Autumn Equinox, when the two heroes ascend.
The Flowery Pond has its sign, the mysterious pearl bursts forth,
act with benevolence, establish virtue,
set up justice, prepare punishments,
guard against deception,
lure and seduce with joyful passions.
Observe the Crimson Continent, qi flourishing, yang surging,
see the Scarlet County, *gui* stirring, lead arising.
Scarlet, the Dragon’s head erects,
crimson, the Tortoise’s eye opens round,
black, the Tiger’s mouth emits sound.
Contending to display their powers,
make yin and yang invert,
unite metal and wood.
Seize the Dark Warrior’s tortoise essence from the north,
lock it in the Yellow Court.
Bathe often, sweep the Three Fields to stillness,
nurture with warmth, ensure the nine transformations are numinous.
Accumulate eight hundred deeds of hidden virtue,
name inscribed in the Upper Clarity,
spirit ascends to Jade Capital,
feasting concludes, drunk on peaches of immortality.

**Fifth Body**
No indulgence for the wild mind-steed,
how could the heart-ape be released?
The Three Corpses cause no disturbance,
the Six Thieves all submit.
Demon realms all forgotten—
preserve robust spirit,
harmonize strong qi and blood.
All cares forgotten, greed and wrath left behind,
ten thousand ties severed, no false thoughts arise.
Encounter the divine maiden tending the furnace to forge the sword,
borrow golden water to pair hardness and softness.
Rely on the craftsman’s hand to capture and seize as easily as turning a palm,
unlock the knife and key,
untie the Dragon and Tiger’s reins.
Drink the immortal wine of extended years,
consume the jade liquor of continued life.
Elixir enters the abdomen, fragrance arises throughout the body,
passion returns to nature, bones revert to yang.
Still the heart’s scenery, seal the earthen crucible,
extinguish the mind’s spring, close the grotto chamber.
Far from sound and color, firmly guard the true constant,
guard against harm—
if encountered, do not lightly lose.
After ten months,
the Infant descends,
nurtured to spiritual communion,
meeting the spirit, alone roams the immortal realm.
Who knows the vastness of heaven and earth in stillness?
I love the long days and months within the gourd.
Let the world’s slander and praise be—
donning cloud robes and crane cloaks,
holding elixir texts and jade chapters,
the immortals of the Purple Palace celebrate together.

**First of the Four "Branch of Flowers"**

chunks.translated_text:
**Second Body**

Crafting the work of creation’s power,
first set hand to harmonize primordial qi.
Since receiving the master’s transmission,
alone I guard non-action.
Jade nectar ever refined,
primordial essence returns to the true seat.
Piercing the three barriers, passing Tail Gate,
the river chariot reverses upward to Mud Pill.
Striking Kunlun, thunder shakes like a roar,
sweet springs flow fragrant as honeyed isles.
Entering the Jade Pool, transformed to golden liquid,
carefree, I drink the self-dripping sweet dew.
Descending the twelve-tiered tower,
firmly sealed and steadfastly guarded—
all is but the three: essence, qi, and spirit.
Returning to the root, restoring life,
all is but the five: metal, wood, water, fire, and earth gathered.
Within the mysterious, the mystery—
the immortal elixir of non-death;
within the wondrous, the wonder—
the root of life’s extension.
Who does not walk this path? Who does not know?
Who does not practice? All are lost
in seeking the precelestial aperture—
how could they dare reckless action?

I, too, amidst the flowers,
drum bamboo and pluck the zither, heart like still water.
From now on, having grasped the true message,
forgetting things, forgetting form,
before midnight and after noon may be held,
in the hours of Mao and You, the time of bathing.
What need to speak of the wheel of life and death?
What need to speak of the maiden and infant?
All is but the gathering—
the primordial chaos before separation, a single grain of millet.

**Third Body**

Heart like a lotus rising from water,
intent swift as lightning in the clouds.
Last night, over a small matter,
I strayed into the spring courtyard.
Moment by moment, rein in the mind-horse,
instant by instant, lock the heart-ape.
Day and night without sleep,
tempering the self, work unceasing.
Seal the Three Treasures within the Yellow Chamber,
capture the Five Thieves beyond the Upper Court.
Command self and other to be thus—steady, unshaken,
make yin and yang overturn, invert.
Withdraw the host of demons, raise the keen-edged sword,
dare to pluck the fresh blossoms beyond the wall,
hang up my mother-born iron face—
I let them stir not the slightest.

Delicate celestial form,
ten fingers slender,
cannot sway my mind-horse or heart-ape.
I am a touchstone—
high or low, instantly revealed;
I am an iron steamed bun—
hard to bite, harder to chew;
I am a sea of purity—
not a speck of dust clings;
I am a luminous pearl—
ever suspended in emptiness.

The Dao firm, the will far-reaching,
from youth I tempered body and mind.
Cut off fame and profit, no greed remains,
seize the Three Corpses, seethe them in the cauldron.
My heart is steadfast,
my mastery of creation unseen by others.
I worry—lest the work go unfulfilled, the name unmade,
time pass in vain;
I worry—lest the sun and moon race like shuttles, praising youth.
One day, turning the heavenly gate,
soaring midair,
only then shall I expound the cold, aloof family tradition of the Daoist teaching.

chunks.original_text: 先明天地机，次把阴阳配。 有天先有母，无母亦无天，此是道教根源。 把周天从头数，将乾坤颠倒安。 月之圆存乎口诀，时之子妙在心传。 提起我无刃锋芒剑，怕则怕急水滩头难住船，感则感黄婆勾引，候则候少女开莲，此事难言。 五千日近坚心算，三十时辰暗里盘。 我将龙头直竖，他把月窟空悬。 显神通向猛火里栽莲，施匠手在逆水上撑船。 不羡他美丽娇花，只待他甘露醴泉。 攻神州，破赤县，捉住金精仔细牵，送入丹田。 防危虑险除杂念，沐浴自然。 面壁九年，才做个阆苑蓬莱物外仙。 第四体 因求大道玄，走尽天涯畔。 撇功名势利，弃家业田园。 万般辛苦，衣破鞋穿师难面。 愁则愁六七十年光阴短，入终南感得火龙亲口传。 命俺出山，觅侣求铅。 遍访名贤，尽是些诡计悭贪窃道玄。 也是俺该有那出世因缘，幸遇着仗义疏财沈万三。 争奈他力薄难全，俺只得把炉火烹煎。 九转完，向丽春院采药行符，经五载入武当山。 面壁调神又九年，猛听得朝命宣。 欲待要不睹君王面，又恐怕胡尚书性命难全。 驾云直上朝阳殿，官家见喜悦龙颜。 俺欲待口口相传，恐违了玉皇命言，俺只得跨风乘鸾上九天。 美金华二首 金华朵朵鲜，无财难修炼。 不敢对人言，各自糊盘算。 访外护未遇高贤，把天机牢抱几年。 聊试验，妙更玄，凭慧剑，采先天。 今日方知，道在目前，才信金丹有正传。 吹的是无孔之笛，弹的是无弦之弦。 喜的是黄芽白雪，爱的是首经红铅。 饮的是延命仙酒，服的是返魂灵丹。 做的是壶中活计，戏的是海底金蟾。 捉将日月炉中炼，夺得乾坤鼎内煎。 这是我修行真诀，出家手段。 恨当初，俺无钱，昼夜告天也可怜； 到而今，时来运转，只待我行满功圆，撒手逍遥物外仙。 金华玉蕊鲜，世人难分辩。 长生须伏气，栽接要真铅。 筑基炼己，采后天玉液还丹。 纵得了住世延年，还要图金液九还。 堪嗤大众学神仙，一个个尽都是盲修瞎炼，一程程谁晓得实究真参！ 天地里黄芽长遍，满乾坤白华开绽，总待他水尽金生月正圆。 我这里手提宝剑挂南山，诛尽了七情六欲，恩爱牵缠，扫尽了万里浮云，一尘不染。 唬的那五鬼三尸心胆寒。 我把阴阳颠倒颠，用神机暗八合周天，戒身心防危虑险。 轻轻的摇动地轴，慢慢的拨转天关，霹雳一声天外天。 一诀天机 说与你，真口诀，指与你，天边月。 月圆时，玉蕊出，月缺时，金花脱。 三五按时节，老嫩细分别。 送入黄婆舍，休教走漏泄。 栽接栽接，灵龟吸尽金马血； 烈决烈决，做个蓬莱三岛客。 玄关交媾曲 大道本无说，妙理话难彻，玄关一点达摩诀。 上至昆仑泥丸顶，下至重渊涌泉穴。 铅为母，汞为爹，铅汞阴阳把子结，姹女婴儿一处歇。 阴阳交会曲 颠倒坎中离，龙虎风云会。 妙玄一点包天地，毫百大小人不知，返三回五透天机。 离归坎，坎归离，坎离水火运东西，婴儿姹女作夫妻。 阴盗阳精取坎实，阳伏阴精神离虚，三三六六分天地。 这些功夫非容易，变乾坤漏泄先天气。 洞天清唱六叠 俺则待剖开混沌包，劈破鸿氵蒙窍。 俺则待觅一滴续命浆，寻一枝返魂草。 俺只见虎啸气来潮，癸动药生苗。 会黄婆将琴豉教，见金公把竹板敲。 不觉的丹田热烧，原来是命宝归黄道。
chunks.translated_text:
First discern the mechanism of Heaven and Earth,
then match yin and yang in their pairing.
Before Heaven there was the Mother;
without the Mother, there would be no Heaven—
this is the root-source of the Daoist teaching.
Count the celestial cycles from the beginning,
invert qian and kun to set them aright.
The moon’s fullness lies in the oral formula,
the hour of zi’s mystery in heart-transmission.
I raise my sword of edge-less sharpness—
what I fear is the rushing rapids where boats stall,
what I sense is the Yellow Dame’s beckoning,
what I await is the Maiden’s unfolding lotus—
this matter is hard to speak of.
Five thousand days, close-calculated with steadfast heart,
thirty hours, silently revolving in the dark.
I stand the Dragon’s Head upright,
he suspends the Moon’s Grotto in emptiness.
Displaying divine power, I plant lotuses in raging fire,
wielding the craftsman’s hand, I pole a boat against the current.
I do not envy lovely, delicate flowers,
only long for the sweet dew and sacred spring.
Assault the Divine Continent, breach the Crimson County,
seize the Golden Essence and lead it carefully,
escort it into the Cinnabar Field.
Guard against danger, dispel stray thoughts,
bathe in spontaneity.
After nine years facing the wall,
I become an immortal beyond the world—
dwelling in Penglai’s paradise.

---

In quest of the Great Dao’s mystery,
I wandered to the ends of the earth.
Cast aside fame, power, and profit,
abandoned home, estate, and fields.
Through myriad hardships,
robes torn, shoes worn, I could barely face my master.
I worried—lest sixty or seventy years of life be too brief,
until entering Zhongnan, I received the Fire Dragon’s oral transmission.
Commanded to leave the mountain, seek companions, and quest for lead,
I visited renowned worthies—
all proved cunning, miserly, and thieving of the Dao’s mystery.
Yet it was my destined karmic cause to emerge in this world,
and fortunately, I met Shen Wansan, generous and true.
Alas, his strength was insufficient to complete the work,
so I had no choice but to tend the furnace and refine the elixir.
After nine revolutions, I went to the Pleasure Garden to gather herbs and enact talismans,
then spent five years on Mount Wudang.
Facing the wall, I harmonized spirit for another nine years,
when suddenly I heard the imperial summons.
I wished to avoid the emperor’s presence,
but feared for Minister Hu’s life.
Riding clouds, I ascended to the Court of the Rising Sun,
where the sovereign’s dragon countenance lit with joy.
I longed to transmit the teaching mouth-to-mouth,
but feared violating the Jade Emperor’s decree—
so I mounted the phoenix and rode the simurgh to the Ninth Heaven.

---

**Two Poems on Golden Flowers**

Golden flowers, fresh and bright,
without wealth, cultivation is hard.
I dare not speak of it to others,
each must calculate for themselves.
Seeking external protectors, I found no worthy sages,
so I held fast to the celestial mechanism for years.
Testing and verifying, wondrous and profound,
relying on the sword of wisdom, I gathered the primordial.
Only now do I know—
the Dao lies before me,
and I truly believe the Golden Elixir has an orthodox transmission.
I play the flute without holes,
strum the stringless zither.
I delight in yellow sprouts and white snow,
cherish the first scripture and red lead.
I drink the wine of life-extension,
consume the soul-returning divine pill.
I engage in the work within the flask,
play with the golden toad at the sea’s bottom.
Seizing sun and moon, I refine them in the furnace,
wresting qian and kun, I seethe them in the crucible.
This is my true method of cultivation,
the skill of one who has left the household.
I regret that in the past,
lacking money, I pleaded with Heaven day and night—
pitiful indeed!
But now, fortune has turned,
and I await only the completion of merit and perfection of work,
to cast off all and become a carefree immortal beyond the world.

Golden flowers, jade buds—fresh and bright,
hard for the world to distinguish.
For immortality, one must subdue qi,
for grafting, true lead is essential.
Lay the foundation, refine the self,
gather postnatal jade liquid to return the elixir.
Even if one attains longevity in this world,
one must still seek the ninefold return of golden liquid.
How laughable are the multitudes who study immortality—
each one blindly cultivating without sight,
step by step, who understands true investigation and real inquiry?
Throughout Heaven and Earth, yellow sprouts grow everywhere,
across the cosmos, white blossoms bloom in profusion—
all await the moment when water is exhausted, gold is born, and the moon is full.
Here, I raise my precious sword and hang it on South Mountain,
slaying the seven emotions and six desires,
sweeping away the ten thousand miles of floating clouds,
leaving not a speck of dust.
The Five Ghosts and Three Corpses tremble in fear.
I invert yin and yang,
use divine strategy to secretly harmonize the eight trigrams of the celestial cycle,
caution body and mind, guard against danger.
Gently, I shake the earth’s axis,
slowly, I turn the heavenly gate—
then, with a thunderclap, a heaven beyond heaven appears.

---

**A Formula of Celestial Mechanism**

I tell you the true oral formula,
point to the moon at the sky’s edge.
When the moon is full, the jade bud emerges;
when the moon wanes, the golden flower falls.
At the third and fifth phases, observe the seasons,
distinguish carefully between old and young.
Send it into the Yellow Dame’s abode,
lest it leak and escape.
Graft and graft again—
the spirit turtle drinks the golden horse’s blood to the last drop.
Decisively, decisively—
become a guest of Penglai’s three isles.

---

**The Song of Mystic Union at the Pass**

The Great Dao is beyond words,
its wondrous principle hard to exhaust—
a single point at the mystic pass is the Dharma’s secret.
From the Kunlun’s mud-pill peak above,
to the bubbling spring cave below,
lead is the mother, mercury the father.
Lead and mercury, yin and yang, form the child’s bond,
the Alchemical Girl and Infant rest together.

---

**The Song of Yin-Yang Union**

Invert kan within li,
dragon and tiger meet in wind and cloud.
A single point of wondrous mystery embraces Heaven and Earth,
yet people great and small know nothing of it—
returning three, revolving five, they penetrate the celestial mechanism.
Li returns to kan, kan returns to li,
kan and li, water and fire, move east and west.
Infant and Alchemical Girl become husband and wife.
Yin steals yang’s essence to take kan’s solidity,
yang subdues yin’s spirit to fill li’s emptiness—
three threes and six sixes divide Heaven and Earth.
These practices are not easy,
transforming qian and kun risks leaking primordial qi.

---

**Six Refrains of the Grotto’s Pure Chant**

I long to split open the primordial chaos,
cleave the vast misty aperture.
I long to find a drop of life-continuing nectar,
seek a sprig of soul-returning herb.
I see the tiger’s roar summon the tide,
gui stirs and the medicine sprouts.
The Yellow Dame teaches with her zither,
the Metal Elder taps his bamboo clappers.
Unawares, the Cinnabar Field grows hot—
the life-treasure has returned to the Yellow Path.
chunks.overlap_context:
irm, the will far-reaching,
from youth I tempered body and mind.
Cut off fame and profit, no greed remains,
seize the Three Corpses, seethe them in the cauldron.
My heart is steadfast,
my mastery of creation unseen by others.
I worry—lest the work go unfulfilled, the name unmade,
time pass in vain;
I worry—lest the sun and moon race like shuttles, praising youth.
One day, turning the heavenly gate,
soaring midair,
only then shall I expound the cold, aloof family tradition of the Daoist teaching.

chunks.original_text: 那时节把神息匀调，静观水火交。 俺将那没底篮仗人挑，俺把那没弦琴怀中抱。 俺轻轻拨正赤凤头。 嘿嘿钻入乌龟窍。 擒阳气，过鹊桥，运阴符，急相包。 忽然觉泥丸如汤沸，丹田似火烧。 设屯蒙，忘昏晓，达四肢，熏蒸到。 若有那魔境相招，俺这里只是，静坐如如不动摇。 炼己将五贼平，换景把七情并。 制伏的六欲宁，扫荡的三田净。 性定自通灵，心虚内照明。 配刚柔，金水称会阴阳，颠倒行。 既济功成，万神悉听命。 闻诏飞升，丹台已注名。 俺只待隐市廛默静功； 俺只待择善地方作用； 俺只待仗慧剑将白雪培，凭匠手把黄芽种； 俺只待搬火炼真空，寻光破鸿氵蒙； 俺只待摄二气归离户，采一阳入震宫。 学旌阳行踪，冲举乘丹风； 仿轩辕神通，飞升跨火龙。 采铅精，配汞苗，立炉鼎，修玄要。 夺乾坤造化机，会日月盈亏妙。 合水火，左右烧，使魂魄，往来交。 按四时，不失序，顺八节，应卦爻。 辨昏朝，明消长，观天道，须教周天十二遭。 七返大珠明了性，九还金液大丹成。 霹雳一声，早见真人出顶。 咏蛰龙法二首 渔父词 蛰法无声却有声，声声说与内心听。 神默默，气冥冥，蛰龙虽睡睡还醒。 蛰龙吟 睡神仙，睡神仙，石根高卧忘其年，三光沉沦性自圆。 气气归玄窍，息息任天然。 莫散乱，须安恬，温养得汞性儿圆，等待他铅花儿现。 无走失，有防闲，真火候，运中间。 行七返，不艰难，炼九还，何嗟叹。 静观龙虎战场战，暗把阴阳颠倒颠。 人言我是蒙目龙汉，我却眠令眠未眠。 学就了，真卧禅，养成了，真胎元，卧龙一起便升天。 此蛰法，是谁传？ 曲肱而枕自尼山，乐在其中无人谙。 五龙飞跃出深潭，天将此法传图南。 图南一派俦能继？ 邋遢道人张丰仙。 丽春院词二首 丽春院内月轮高，琼树花新破寂寥。 半夜开丹灶，三更运斗梢。 王汉银河谁得到，牛郎织女天边笑。 紫府会仙曹，归去来兮俗垢消。 又 丽春院内日华清，金液还丹已炼成。 欲令情归性，须将性合情。 富贵功名休再问，婴儿姹女风流甚。 炉鼎放光明，从此昆仑顶上行。 西江月 道在玄关一窍，窍包元气元精。 元精元气养元神，神满自然动静。 动静三回九转，周流变化乾坤。 乾坤颠倒种花根，根发四江月正。 鹧鸪天 战魔须战睡魔先，此是修行第一鞭。 目下辛勤熬一夜，壶中月月换千年。 筑基事，志要坚，须凭玄牝觅玄玄。 神归气复成丹体，然后开炉讲炼铅。 自题《无根树》词二首 鹧鸪天 逆法流传有正邪，入邪背正遍天溉。 飞腾罕见穿云风，陷溺多成落井蛙。 难与辨，乱纷哗，都将赤土作丹砂。 要知端的通玄路，细玩无根树下花。 卖花声 无根树下说真常，六道合灵共一光。 会得威音前后事，本无来去貌堂堂。 无根树道情二十四首 无根树，花正幽，贪恋红尘谁肯修？ 浮生事，苦海舟，荡去飘来不自由。 无边无岸难泊系，长在鱼龙险处游。 肯回首，是岸头，莫待风波坏了舟。 无根树，花正微，树老将新接嫩枝。 桃寄柳，桑接梨，传与修真作样儿。 自古神仙栽接法，人老原来有药医。 访明师，问万儿，下手速修犹太迟。 无根树，花正青，花酒神仙占到今。 烟花寨，酒内林，不犯荤腥不犯淫。 犯淫丧失长生宝，酒肉穿肠道在心。
chunks.translated_text:
At that moment, harmonize spirit and breath,
in stillness watch water and fire intertwine.
I take up the bottomless basket, borne by another’s strength,
I cradle the stringless zither in my arms.
Gently I pluck the crimson phoenix’s head—
*heh heh*—piercing the black turtle’s aperture.
Seizing yang qi, crossing the Magpie Bridge,
moving yin talismans, swiftly enfolding them.
Suddenly the Mud Pill Palace boils like scalding soup,
the Cinnabar Field burns like fire.
Setting up *zhun* and *meng*, forgetting dawn and dusk,
pervading the four limbs, steaming them through.
Should demonic visions arise to beckon,
here I remain, sitting in suchness, unshaken.

Temper the self, pacifying the Five Thieves,
shift the scenery, merging the Seven Emotions.
Subduing the Six Desires to stillness,
sweeping the Three Fields clean.
Nature settles and naturally becomes numinous,
the heart empties and inwardly shines bright.
Matching hardness and softness,
gold and water meet to balance yin and yang, moving in reversal.
Once the *jiji* work is complete,
the ten thousand spirits all heed command.
Hearing the decree, ascending in flight,
the name is already inscribed on the Cinnabar Terrace.

I only await concealing myself in the marketplace to silently cultivate;
I only await choosing a propitious place to put it into practice;
I only await wielding the sword of wisdom to nurture the white snow,
relying on the craftsman’s hand to plant the yellow sprout;
I only await moving fire to refine true emptiness,
seeking light to break through the vast misty aperture;
I only await gathering the two qi to return to the Li Chamber,
gathering one yang to enter the Zhen Palace.

Following Master Jingyang’s footsteps,
soaring aloft riding the cinnabar phoenix;
emulating the Yellow Emperor’s divine powers,
ascending in flight astride the fire dragon.
Gathering lead essence,
pairing it with mercury sprouts,
erecting the crucible and furnace,
cultivating the mysteries’ essentials.
Seizing the creative mechanism of qian and kun,
grasping the wondrous waxing and waning of sun and moon.
Uniting water and fire, burning left and right,
directing hun and po to intermingle and exchange.
Following the four seasons without missing their sequence,
accord with the eight nodes, responding to the hexagrams’ lines.
Discerning dawn and dusk, clarifying growth and decline,
observing the heavenly Dao, completing twelve circuits of the celestial sphere.
The Seven-Return Great Pearl illuminates the nature,
the Nine-Return Golden Elixir completes the Great Medicine.
With a thunderous crack,
the Perfected One emerges from the crown.

**Two Chants on the Hibernating Dragon Method**

*Fisherman’s Song*
The hibernation method is soundless yet resounding,
the resounding sound speaks to the inner heart.
Spirit silent, qi obscure,
the hibernating dragon, though asleep, remains awake.

*Hibernating Dragon’s Chant*
Sleeping immortal, sleeping immortal,
highly reclining at the stone’s root, forgetting the years.
The Three Lights sink and merge, nature becomes whole.
Qi after qi returns to the mysterious aperture,
breath after breath follows nature’s course.
Do not scatter, must be tranquil,
nurturing the mercury nature to perfection,
awaiting the appearance of the lead flower.
No loss, with vigilance,
true fire timing, moving in between.
Practicing the Seven Returns is not difficult,
refining the Nine Returns—why sigh?
Silently watching the dragon and tiger’s battlefield,
secretly reversing yin and yang.
People say I am a blind dragon of the Han,
yet I sleep, commanding sleep, not truly asleep.
Once mastered, the true reclining meditation,
once nurtured, the true primordial embryo—
the hibernating dragon rises and ascends to heaven.

This hibernation method—who transmitted it?
Folding arms for a pillow, from Confucius’ mountain,
delighting in its midst, unknown to others.
Five dragons leap and soar from the deep pool,
Heaven bestowed this method to Tu Nan.
Who in Tu Nan’s lineage can continue it?
The slovenly Daoist Zhang Fengxian.

**Two Lyrics of the Courtyard of Beautiful Spring**

In the Courtyard of Beautiful Spring, the moon’s wheel hangs high,
jade trees bloom anew, breaking the silence.
At midnight the elixir furnace is opened,
at the third watch the Dipper’s handle is turned.
Who has reached the Silver River of the Han?
The Cowherd and Weaver Girl laugh from heaven’s edge.
In the Purple Mansion, the immortals gather—
return, return, the worldly filth is cleansed.

Again,
In the Courtyard of Beautiful Spring, the sun’s brilliance is clear,
the golden liquid and returned elixir are already refined.
To make emotion return to nature,
must merge nature with emotion.
Wealth and honor, fame and merit—ask no more,
the Infant and Alchemical Girl are most enchanting.
The furnace and cauldron radiate light—
from here, journey to the Kunlun’s summit.

**West River Moon**
The Dao resides in the mysterious pass’s aperture,
the aperture contains primordial qi and primordial essence.
Primordial essence and primordial qi nurture the primordial spirit,
when the spirit is full, movement and stillness arise naturally.
Movement and stillness, three revolutions and nine transformations,
circulating through the changes of qian and kun.
Reversing qian and kun to plant the flower’s root,
the root sprouts, the four rivers’ moon is full.

**Partridge Sky**
To battle demons, first battle the sleep demon,
this is the first whip in cultivation.
Diligently enduring one night’s toil,
in the pot, months change over a thousand years.
The work of laying the foundation requires steadfast resolve,
must rely on the mysterious female to seek the mysterious within the mysterious.
When spirit returns and qi is restored, the elixir body forms,
only then open the furnace to discuss refining lead.

**Two Self-Inscriptions on the “Rootless Tree” Lyrics**

*Partridge Sky*
The counterflow method spreads, both orthodox and heterodox,
entering heterodoxy and forsaking orthodoxy pervades the world.
Few soar like phoenixes piercing the clouds,
many drown like frogs fallen in wells.
Hard to distinguish, chaotic clamor—
all take red earth for cinnabar.
To know the true path to the mysterious,
study closely the flowers beneath the rootless tree.

*Cry of the Flower Seller*
Beneath the rootless tree, speaking of the true constant,
the six paths merge with spirit, sharing one light.
Understanding matters before and after the Sound of Thunder,
originally without coming or going, majestic in form.

**Twenty-Four Daoist Songs of the Rootless Tree**

The rootless tree, its flowers in seclusion—
who, enamored of the red dust, would cultivate?
Floating life’s affairs are a bitter sea’s boat,
drifting to and fro, not free.
Boundless and shore-less, hard to moor,
always swimming in the perilous realm of fish and dragons.
If willing to turn back, that is the shore—
do not wait for the wind and waves to wreck your boat.

The rootless tree, its flowers delicate—
the old tree renews itself with tender branches.
Peaches grafted to willows,
mulberries grafted to pears,
passed down as models for those who cultivate the true.
Since ancient times, immortals’ grafting methods—
when people grow old, there is medicine to heal.
Seek a bright teacher, inquire of the myriad methods—
beginning practice is already too late.

The rootless tree, its flowers verdant—
flower and wine immortals have claimed them to this day.
The brothel’s stronghold,
the forest within wine—
not violating the precepts against meat and lust.
Violating lust loses the treasure of long life,
meat and wine pass through the intestines, yet the Dao is in the heart.

**Six Refrains of the Grotto’s Pure Chant**

I long to split open the primordial chaos,
cleave the vast misty aperture.
I long to find a drop of life-continuing nectar,
seek a sprig of soul-returning herb.
I see the tiger’s roar summon the tide,
gui stirs and the medicine sprouts.
The Yellow Dame teaches with her zither,
the Metal Elder taps his bamboo clappers.
Unawares, the Cinnabar Field grows hot—
the life-treasure has returned to the Yellow Path.

chunks.translated_text:
Open the gate, I speak to you—
without wine, without flowers, the Dao cannot be fulfilled.

The rootless tree, its flowers solitary—
I ask: do yin and yang find their kind?
A hen’s egg cannot hatch a chick,
for it has turned its back on the furnace of yin and yang.
A woman without a husband is a resentful maiden,
a man without a wife is a forsaken bachelor.
Alas for the deluded, so utterly confused—
sitting in stillness, cultivating alone, their qi withers dry.

The rootless tree, its flowers askew—
severed from yin and yang, the Dao is incomplete.
Gold is cut off from wood, mercury from lead,
yang widowed, yin orphaned—each to its own side.
In the world, yin and yang pair man with woman,
begetting sons and grandsons, generation after generation.
Following the flow, one becomes a mortal;
reversing it, one becomes an immortal—
all lies in the turning of the cheek.

The rootless tree, its flowers newly bloomed—
born in the direction of *kun*, and *kun* is human.
Pluck the flower, wear it;
gather the flower’s heart,
its layered pistils bright with spring’s splendor.
Yet people do not grasp the principle within the flower—
a single secret of heaven’s mechanism is worth ten thousand gold.
Borrow the flower’s name, embody the flower’s form,
each line of *Knocking on the Trigrams* speaks truly.

The rootless tree, its flowers in full bloom—
their smiling faces, delicate features like powdered petals.
Guard against the monkey and horse, ever more stubborn—
hang up the iron mask your mother gave you.
Draw forth the true treasure-sword of the Azure Dragon,
pluck every fresh blossom from the garden wall.
Hoist the wind-filled sail, return fully laden—
how could one journey empty-handed to the mountain of treasure!

The rootless tree, its flowers taking flight—
once shed, they open again at the appointed time.
When lead’s flower appears, when *gui* is exhausted,
once more the western garden’s branches brim with blossoms.
Just gathered beneath the moon,
they are already mended into robes at dawn’s first light.
This mystery is rarely known in the world—
it must be pondered carefully with the immortals.

The rootless tree, its flowers in full bloom—
plucked from within the crescent-moon furnace.
They extend life, lessen illness and calamity—
find good companions, prepare the means for the method.
From this, the treasure of heaven may be achieved—
let the deluded masses laugh at my folly.
I urge the wise: do not feign cleverness,
without a bright teacher, do not force guesses.

The rootless tree, its flowers perfectly round—
the fruit ripens, its flavor complete.
Like a crimson tangerine, like a pellet,
guard it well, never let down your vigilance.
Learn the method of plants gathering their essence—
return to life, revert to the root, restore the origin.
Choose a sacred site, build a Daoist hermitage,
unite with the primordial to accomplish the great return.

The rootless tree, its flowers flourishing—
speaking of rootlessness, yet it has roots.
The three talents’ apertures, the two true essences—
when heaven and earth unite, the myriad things are born.
When sun and moon unite, cold and heat follow in order;
when man and woman unite, conception begins.
How clear this is—
I tell you plainly,
only fear that when you meet it, you will not recognize it truly.

The rootless tree, its flowers at their finest—
facing the scene, forget emotion, admire the moon’s radiance.
The golden essence flourishes, dazzling the eye—
do not mistakenly pick the wrong melon in the garden.
The five metals and eight minerals are all false,
the ten thousand herbs and thousand grasses are all amiss.
The golden toad, the jade crow—
recognize true lead, and you are the master.

The rootless tree, its flowers abundant—
when they bloom everywhere, they span the river of desire.
Hard to pluck, what can be done?
Step by step, tread the dragon and tiger’s den.
Having gathered the yellow flower, return to the cave—
your name inscribed in the Purple Palace, never to fade.
Laughing heartily, oh white clouds—
prepare the ladder to ascend the Great Canopy.

The rootless tree, its flowers fragrant—
in the warm lead crucible, the treasure’s light appears.
On the golden bridge, gaze toward the winding river—
in the moon, the sun is clearly seen.
Swallow the raven’s liver and hare’s marrow,
replace all the dust and grime of your old intestines.
The realm of fame and profit,
the land of love and attachment—
never turn back, ceaselessly rushing in vain.

The rootless tree, its flowers fresh—
talisman fire sears mercury and lead together.
At the furnace’s edge, the scene appears before you—
gathering depends entirely on the ferryboat of the method.
A master craftsman, strong and steady, holds the helm,
no matter how the vast waves churn in the sea’s depths.
Pass the three barriers, penetrate the mud pill,
early on, pierce the nine apertures of the entire body.

The rootless tree, its flowers rich—
recognize true lead as the primal ancestor.
Essence, vitality, spirit—
refined together in one crucible,
the woman transforms into man, the old into youth.
Wishing to capture the White Tiger in the west,
first subdue the Azure Dragon in the east.
When kinds are alike, apply effort well—
when the outer medicine flows, the inner medicine flows.

The rootless tree, its flowers delicate—
the tree of heaven’s root, its flowers fair.
Heaven responds with stars, earth with tides.
The dragon-slaying sword, the tiger-binding cord—
revolve the celestial pivot, turn the Dipper’s handle.
Temper a furnace of true sun and moon,
sweep away the three thousand six hundred paths.
Step into the clouds, roam freely—
all sins, all worldly dust, are wiped away in one stroke.

The rootless tree, its flowers towering—
ocean waves surge to the sky, the moon plays with the tide.
The path of the Silver River,
piercing the nine heavens,
a ladder climbs the void to moor at the Dipper’s handle.
Touch the Weaving Maiden’s loom stone,
tread the Cowherd’s magpie bridge.
Meeting the immortals’ court, with bold courage,
steal the Queen Mother of the Jasper Pool’s peaches.

The rootless tree, its flowers in pairs—
dragon and tiger mount the altar, battling fiercely.
Lead enters mercury,
yin matches yin—
the image of the mysterious pearl, its price beyond value.
This is the true seed of the homeland,
returning the old to youth, lengthening life.
Ascend to heaven, to the land of ultimate bliss—
spare yourself the wheel of rebirth, the sight of Yama.

The rootless tree, its flowers wondrous—
cultivated in the moon for a brief moment.
The hand that grasps clouds, the ladder that climbs them—
gather the first primordial branch.
Drinking wine with flowers, the spirit is refreshed,
laughing at the immortal elder drunk as mud.
Entrust your heart to knowledge, guard it carefully—
only fear the furnace’s fire timing will fly away.

The rootless tree, its flowers golden—
born in the central land of *wu* and *ji*.
The eastern family’s daughter, the western family’s son—
matched as husband and wife, they enter the bridal chamber.
The Yellow Dame urges them to drink the ghee-like wine,
each day intoxicated, steaming with drunkenness.
This immortal formula, this soul-returning nectar—
the Medicine King who revives the dead and restores life.

The rootless tree, its flowers radiant—
the moon’s essence, heaven’s heart, presses upon the sun’s soul.
The golden crow’s marrow, the jade hare’s essence—
seize these two, refine them together in one vessel.

chunks.translated_text:
The yang fire and yin tally divide at *zi* and *wu*,
bathing rites arrive at the gates of *mao* and *you*.
Guard the Yellow Court, nurture the Valley Spirit—
a man conceives the embryo, laughing to scorn.

The rootless tree, its flowers crimson—
pluck all its red blossoms, leaving the tree bare.
Emptiness is form, form is emptiness,
discern true emptiness within form.
Once true emptiness is realized, form vanishes,
yet the Dharma-body endures, never falling into void.

Named Perfect Penetration, called the Great Hero,
nine generations ascend to the ninefold heavens.

The rootless tree, its flowers now absent—
shadowless, formless, hard to depict in images.
Nameless, yet heeding the call,
seized into the crucible of creation.
Circulate the Samadhi fire of the Celestial Cycle,
temper true emptiness to return to the Great Void.

Visit the immortal capital, receive the celestial tally—
only then is one a true man, a great husband.

*Four Seasons’ Daoist Sentiments* – Four Poems

**Spring**
Spring’s hues delight the heart,
peach and apricot blossoms renew the eye.
The mountain garden’s fresh scenes,
behold—no cares or sorrows.
Immortals rejoice in touring grotto-heavens in spring.
Master Zi Jin plays his jade flute,
the jade flute’s notes for the knowing ear.
As for me, when leisure comes,
I burn a censer of incense, pluck a tune on the zither.

**Summer**
Summer’s lotus pools, lotus pools,
a pair of mandarin ducks skims the water’s surface.
Arranged in couples,
cool winds and moonlit nights for carefree play.
Immortals rejoice in Lü Zu’s meeting with Zhongli,
the two elders leaving behind the land of longevity.
On Mount Zhongnan, they ride the clouds away.
As for me, when leisure comes,
I burn a censer of incense, play a game of chess.

**Autumn**
Autumn’s sparse clouds, sparse clouds,
distant peaks yellow, trees’ leaves withered.
Night reveals the Silver River’s spread,
the Herd-boy comes to ferry the Weaver Girl.
Immortals rejoice in the fortune-teller’s seclusion in Chengdu,
Master Junping raises his jade flask,
daily earning a hundred coins to buy wine.
As for me, when leisure comes,
I burn a censer of incense, read a scroll of scripture.

**Winter**
Winter’s flying snow, flying snow,
ten thousand *li* of passes and mountains like jade heaps.
He Jing hides in his hut to sleep,
in the cold, cranes guard solitary Mount Gu.
Immortals rejoice in Han Xiang’s conversion of Master Wen,
though repeatedly urged to turn back, he would not,
only meeting on the road to Blue Pass.
As for me, when leisure comes,
I light a stick of incense, paint a plum tree.

These *Four Seasons’ Daoist Sentiments* were composed by me in reclusion on Mount Zhongnan, to sing for myself. Together they adopt the style of *Bamboo Branch* songs—each stanza a hard stop, appearing disjointed, yet their subtlety lies precisely in the connection of disconnection.

Self-inscribed.
Left in inscription at Green Goat Palace.

chunks.translated_text:
Seeking old friends across the ends of the earth, yet none appear—
I sigh at those deluded fools who would learn to be immortals.
Some cling to stubborn emptiness,
with yin but no yang, a solitary refinement;
some rely on crucibles and vessels,
discarding life and death to prattle of "harvesting and battle."
Each grasps but one corner,
the Mysterious Pass unknown to them all.
Do not dress up *wuwei* as mere pretense—
all is but an empty facade.
How might one find cloud companions and rosy-hued friends,
to blend with the world and harmonize its light for a few years?

To seek the Dao, one must seek the Primordial,
for the Primordial is what immortals transmit from mouth to mouth,
and immortals do but slumber amidst the flowers.
Refining millet grains requires both method and resources;
matters of the heart and belly demand two or three trusted companions.
How might one find a Zhang Huanwei to discourse on the Mysterious,
or a Ma Banzhou to cultivate refinement together?
Xue Daoguang once returned to the secular,
while Wang Chongyang was fortunate to meet a true affinity.
Elder Bai Duan sought friends in Fufeng County,
and Patriarch Bodhidharma attained the Dao in a pleasure garden.
Only then does one realize that the streets of flowers and willows are just as fit for Chan inquiry—
no more talk of "pure emptiness" and "effortless non-action" in idle sitting.

To seek the Dao, one must seek the Primordial,
for the Primordial is what immortals transmit from mouth to mouth,
and immortals do but slumber amidst the flowers.
Seeking a true master with earnest devotion, countless times—
all claim to have received authentic transmission,
some immortal and their dharma kin.
One speaks of mending the Upper Field,
another of replenishing the Lower Origin.
One insists that guarding the Central Yellow is the true Dharma-eye,
while mocking those who take the space between the two kidneys as the Mysterious Pass.
With such a thousand doors and ten thousand gates,
on a hundred-foot pole, countless worthy souls have been misled.
To seek the Way, one must seek the Primordial.
The Primordial is what immortals transmit from mouth to mouth,
and immortals do but slumber amidst the flowers.

Let those who would learn immortality heed my words—
never blindly cultivate or recklessly refine.
One must understand the inner and outer yin and yang,
and what thing of like kind they are.
One must refine yin and yang in accord with yin and yang,
and cultivate the world-transcending in accord with worldly dharmas.
Following the flow, one becomes human;
reversing it, one becomes immortal—
a single phrase surpasses thousands upon thousands.
No more talk of "pure emptiness" and "effortless non-action,"
for without obtaining the Reverted Elixir, all is in vain.

To seek the Dao, one must seek the Primordial,
for the Primordial is what immortals transmit from mouth to mouth,
and immortals do but slumber amidst the flowers.

*Five Watches’ Daoist Sentiments*
**First Watch**
Alone I herd the green ox,
never letting it run wild or wander idly.
Here I shift scenes and alter moods,
plucking flowers and breaking willows,
secretly refining and cultivating in seclusion.
Closing the six gates, I guard stillness with *wuwei*,
capturing the five thieves with method to bind and imprison.
Matching hardness with softness,
enduring the cycles of spring and autumn.
With spirit full and flourishing, I stand complete.

chunks.original_text: 采药何愁！ 二更里匹配调和。 逐散诸阴，赶退群魔。 俺只要招凤来巢，唤龟还窟，引虎归窝。 看铅生须知谨守，逢月现认得真么。 下手莫错。 望远时过，赤水合珠。 造化元那！ 三更中一阳才萌。 赤县门开，真杰方升。 这时节微露铅华，初含玉蕊。 半吐金精。 锁心猿龙吟云应，拴意马虎啸风生。 采颗芝英。 送入黄庭，封固无虞，百日功灵。 四更残饮罢醍醐，乘槎张骞，笑煞麻姑。 凭这点灌溉三田，融通百脉。 润泽肌肤。 周流遍牢关土釜，升降毕谨守如初。 念忠皆无，声色尽除。 温养胎仙，十月功夫。 五更终添汞抽铅，换鼎分丹，移丹上田。 从今后阳长阴消，性成命全，体固身坚。 静调神一周渐大，勤面壁九载还元。 行满功圆。 八百三千，与道合真，便是神仙。 五更道情五首 一更里。 铅汞全，三尸六贼都游散。 心猿意马牢拴定，铅鼎温温永不寒。 诸魔不敢抬头看。 安神息，任天然，龙自吟。 虎自欢。 这桩妙理行持惯，遍身水火配离坎。 成仙成圣何嗟叹。 要做个长生也不难。 曾记得火龙直指得还丹，逍遥自在，自在神仙。 二更里。 丹诏来，乘龙跨凤春霄外。 大还到手人人爱。 方信金丹好药材。 母见娇儿共一堆。 安稳睡。 且妆呆。 清虚地，不染埃。 从今灭郊冤家债。 做一个长生不老。 养就了杏脸桃腮。 三更里，活子时，仙家美景现华池。 灵龟吸尽金乌髓，丹凤衔来玉兔脂。 玄明酒，醉如痴，群阴尽，艳阳期。 一枝春色金花刚，佳人有意心相许，郎君把玩两情怡。 得遇了还元返本，寿与天齐。 四更里，更漏深，铅生癸后阴阳分。 正值一弦金水满，恰似莺花二月春。 不贪财，不爱名。 饮琼浆。 听玉音。 碧天连本清波净，虚白堂前拴意马，无影树下锁心猿。 三回九转真人现，得遇了先天大道，寿比乾坤。 五更里，来得他，功名富贵都抛下。 一心盼望蓬莱景，十洲三岛便为家。 免欲火，无牵挂，这长生，在自家。 养育恩情休要差，逢人莫说艰难话，刀兵唬全然不怕。 任你是艳色垂帘，再不恋路柳墙花。 五更道情五首 一更里，入禅房，清净身心不用忙，心猿意马休轻放。 守定灵台白玉光，无事真人里面藏。 主翁端坐昆仑上，黄婆勾引入洞房。 婴儿姹女配成双，三家会合曲江上。 二更里，上蒲团，思念父母末生前，本来面目常发现。 采取先天补后天，三关运转至泥丸。 华池神水频吞咽，水火相交暖下田。 偃月炉中至宝煎，三回九转把丹炼。 三更里，一阳生，坎离交媾结婚姻，无牵无挂常清净。 海底泥牛直上奔，绵绵一杰透昆仑。 金水夫妻来交并，白雪长生在黄庭。 炼就金丹不坏身，方才识透玄关性。 四更里，觅宗风，西来大意在其中，时时常把功夫用。 皓月当空彻顶红，照看自己主人翁。 方知炉内铅投汞，玲珑塔里现真宗。 金丹炼就了真空，千年万载身不动， 五更里，合天机，玄关一窍少人知，谁人识得生死地！ 全凭戊己产婴儿，金光灿烂现牟尼。 至宝收在丹田里，养就灵极与天齐。 阳神妙体同太虚，黍珠一粒包天地。 五更道情五首 一更里，万事休，抖精神，坐床头。 巍巍不动主人守，偃月炉中黄芽逗，七宝林中正液流，真阳一撞三关透。 顷刻间水火既济，灌泥丸降下重楼。 二更里，心要坚，三尸神，在目前。
chunks.translated_text:
**Second Watch**
Why fear herb-gathering?
At the second watch, harmonize and blend.
Drive away the host of yin,
banish the legion of demons.
I only seek to lure the phoenix to its nest,
call the tortoise back to its cave,
guide the tiger home to its den.
When lead stirs, guard it with care;
when the moon appears, recognize its truth.
Strike not amiss.
Gazing afar, time passes—
the Red Waters merge with the Pearl.
How wondrous the workings of creation!

**Third Watch**
At the third watch, the first yang begins to sprout.
The gates of the Red Continent swing open,
the true adept ascends.
Now the lead’s luster faintly gleams,
the jade bud first enfolds,
half-revealing its golden essence.
Bind the heart-ape—dragons chant in clouded response;
tether the will-horse—tigers roar as winds arise.
Pluck a sprig of magic fungus,
bear it to the Yellow Court,
seal it fast—no cause for fear.
A hundred days, and the work bears fruit.

**Fourth Watch**
At the fourth watch, the last drops of ghee are drunk.
Riding the raft, Zhang Qian laughs,
while Ma Gu is left in astonishment.
With this single drop, irrigate the Three Fields,
fuse the hundred meridians,
moisten flesh and skin.
Circulate through the sturdy Passes and earthen crucible,
ascend and descend—guard as before.
All thoughts of loyalty vanish,
sounds and sights dissolve.
Nurture the fetal immortal—
ten months’ labor.

**Fifth Watch**
At the fifth watch, add mercury and draw forth lead,
exchange the crucible, divide the elixir,
move the elixir to the Upper Field.
From now on, yang waxes as yin wanes,
nature is perfected, life is whole,
the body firm, the form enduring.
Quietly harmonize the spirit—its unity gradually expands;
diligently face the wall—nine years return to the origin.
When deeds are complete and merit full,
eight hundred and three thousand—
united with the Dao, true as an immortal.

---

**Five Watches’ Daoist Sentiments**

**First Watch**
Lead and mercury complete,
the Three Corpses and Six Thieves all scatter.
Heart-ape and will-horse firmly bound,
the lead crucible warm, never cold.
No demon dares lift its head.
Calm the spirit, rest at ease—let nature take its course.
The dragon chants of its own,
the tiger rejoices on its own.
Master this wondrous principle through steadfast practice,
fire and water paired as *li* and *kan* throughout the body.
To become immortal or sage—what lament remains?
To achieve longevity is no difficult task.
I recall the *Fire Dragon’s Direct Pointer* to the Reverted Elixir—
carefree and at ease,
an immortal at leisure.

**Second Watch**
The elixir’s decree arrives,
riding dragons, mounting phoenixes beyond the spring clouds.
The Great Return in hand—all cherish it.
Now one believes the golden elixir is fine medicine.
Mother and darling child reunited as one.
Sleep soundly,
feign foolishness.
In the realm of purity,
untouched by dust.
From now on, settle old debts of enmity,
become one who never ages.
Nurtured to bloom like apricot cheeks and peach blossoms.

**Third Watch**
At the living midnight hour,
the immortal’s fair scene appears in the Flowery Pond.
The sacred tortoise drinks the essence of the Golden Crow,
the cinnabar phoenix bears the marrow of the Jade Hare.
*Xuanming* wine—
drunk as if mad.
The host of yin vanishes,
the radiant yang season dawns.
A branch of spring’s hue—golden blossoms just opened,
the fair one’s heart inclined, consenting,
the young lord delights in mutual joy.
Having met the return to origin and reversion to root,
longevity equals heaven’s span.

**Fourth Watch**
As the watch deepens,
lead stirs after *gui*—yin and yang part.
Just as the first string of gold and water fills,
like orioles and flowers in the second month of spring.
No greed for wealth,
no love of fame.
Drink the nectar,
listen to the jade tones.
The azure sky merges with its root—clear waves pure,
before the Hall of Empty Whiteness, tether the will-horse,
beneath the shadowless tree, lock the heart-ape.
Three revolutions, nine transformations—the true person appears.
Having met the primordial Great Dao,
longevity surpasses heaven and earth.

**Fifth Watch**
He comes at last—
rank, wealth, and honor all cast aside.
With single mind, long for Penglai’s scenes,
let the Ten Continents and Three Isles be home.
Free from desire’s fire,
no entanglements.
This longevity
lies within oneself.
Nurture gratitude for upbringing—do not falter,
meet others without speaking of hardship,
fear no blade or soldier.
Though beauties drape their curtains,
never again yearn for roadside willows or garden flowers.

---

**Five Watches’ Daoist Sentiments**

**First Watch**
Enter the meditation chamber,
body and mind pure—no need to rush.
Heart-ape and will-horse, do not let them stray.
Guard the spirit terrace—white jade’s light,
the true person within, unoccupied.
The master sits atop Kunlun,
the Yellow Dame lures them into the bridal chamber.
Infant boy and maiden girl paired as one,
the three families meet by the Winding River.

**Second Watch**
Ascend the meditation mat,
contemplate parents before birth—
the original face ever revealed.
Gather the primordial to mend the later heaven,
the Three Passes revolve to the Mud Pill.
Swallow often the divine water of the Flowery Pond,
fire and water merge, warming the Lower Field.
In the crescent moon crucible, the supreme treasure simmers,
three revolutions, nine transformations—refine the elixir.

**Third Watch**
As the first yang stirs,
*kan* and *li* unite in marital bliss,
no entanglements, ever pure.
The mud ox from the sea’s depths surges straight up,
a continuous stream of vitality pierces Kunlun.
The gold-water couple comes to join,
eternal white snow resides in the Yellow Court.
Having refined the golden elixir—an indestructible body,
only then does one fathom the mystery of the Pass.

**Fourth Watch**
Seek the ancestral wind,
the great intent from the West lies within.
Constantly apply effort,
the bright moon overhead, crimson to the crown,
illuminating one’s own master.
Now one knows: in the crucible, lead meets mercury,
within the exquisite pagoda, the true lineage appears.
The golden elixir refined—true emptiness,
for a thousand years, ten thousand ages, the body unmoved.

**Fifth Watch**
Align with heaven’s mechanism,
the mystery of the One Aperture—few know it.
Who recognizes the realm of life and death?
All depends on *wu* and *ji* to birth the infant,
golden light resplendent—Muni revealed.
The supreme treasure gathered in the Cinnabar Field,
nurtured to spiritual perfection, equal to heaven.
The yang spirit’s wondrous form merges with the Great Void,
a single grain of millet embraces heaven and earth.

---

**Five Watches’ Daoist Sentiments**

**First Watch**
Let all matters rest,
rouse the spirit, sit at the bed’s head.
Majestic and unmoving, the master guards,
in the crescent moon crucible, the yellow sprout teases,
within the Seven Treasures Grove, the true fluid flows.
A single thrust of true yang pierces the Three Passes.
In an instant, water and fire achieve harmony,
irrigating the Mud Pill, descending the Tower of Nine Stories.

**Second Watch**
The heart must be steadfast,
the Three Corpses and gods—ever before one’s eyes.

chunks.original_text: 七情六欲来磨炼，目前仗起青锋剑，倒跨白牛走上山，阳神去把阴兵战。 顷刻间水火既济，一霎时撞过三关。 三更里，要持行，采先天，兔逢鹰。 杳冥之内来真信，铅汞相投归炉鼎，取坎填离入内庭，黄婆用意相勾引。 顷刻间水火既济，六月天井底成冰。 四更里，用功勤，要高提，智慧灯。 方把虎龙擒得定，紫阳双修性与命，散则成杰聚成形，九还七返真人认。 顷刻间水火既济，退阴符炼就阳神。 五更里，莫放参，将白牛，赶上山。 婴儿出见明珠现，金丹一粒如珠点，收来放去任回还。 尸贼锁在空王殿。 顷刻间水火既济。 百日功老变童颜。 五更道情五首 静中观面观象，搜寻道窍根源。 太乙炉巾运周天，三昧真火锻炼。 箭射九王铁鼓，三关运转泥丸。 拿着宝月配日眠，此时铅汞相见。 一更里，马稳莫放猿猴跳。 气静神清，自然心地扫。 看守黄庭，运转先天道。 清静闲观，透出玄中妙。 乘一时寸心定。 性在天边海底命。 悟着青铜镜，青铜镜。 无象光明铁陀硬。 你看你，变乾坤，采日精，尽都听，法王令。 二更里，炉内万朵莲花放。 炼就黄芽，一点从天降。 死中拨活，无象却有象。 普照十方，到处皆明亮。 看天沟明耀耀，牧放群羊拍手笑。 早把云梦跳，云梦跳。 脚踏灵台高声叫。
chunks.translated_text:
**Third Watch**
The Seven Passions and Six Desires come to temper,
before one’s eyes, the Azure Blade is raised.
Riding backward on the White Ox, ascending the mountain,
the yang spirit wages war against the yin soldiers.
In an instant, water and fire achieve harmony,
in a flash, the Three Passes are breached.

**Fourth Watch**
Hold fast to the practice,
gather the primordial, the hare meets the hawk.
Within the boundless dark, true tidings arrive,
lead and mercury unite in the crucible,
drawing from Kan to fill Li, entering the inner court,
the Yellow Dame directs with intent to guide.
In an instant, water and fire achieve harmony,
in the sixth month, ice forms at the well’s bottom.

**Fifth Watch**
Diligence in effort,
the Wisdom Lamp must be held high.
Only then can tiger and dragon be subdued,
Zǐyáng’s dual cultivation of nature and life.
Scattered, they become heroes; gathered, they take form.
The Nine Returns and Seven Reversions—the true person recognizes.
In an instant, water and fire achieve harmony,
the yin tally retreats, the yang spirit refined.

**Final Watch**
Do not slacken,
drive the White Ox up the mountain.
The infant emerges, the luminous pearl appears,
a single grain of golden elixir like a pearl’s gleam,
drawn in and released at will, circling endlessly.
The corpse-thieves are locked in the Hall of the Empty King.
In an instant, water and fire achieve harmony.
A hundred days’ work transforms the old into a youth’s visage.

---

**Five Watches’ Daoist Sentiments**

Within stillness, observe the face and behold the signs,
searching for the root of the Dao’s apertures.
In the Tàiyǐ crucible, the celestial circuit revolves,
the true fire of Samādhi forges and refines.
An arrow strikes the iron drum of the Nine Kings,
the Three Passes turn, the Mud Pill moves.
Seizing the moon’s treasure to pair with the sun’s rest,
now lead and mercury meet.

**First Watch**
The horse steady, let not the monkey leap.
Qi still, spirit clear—naturally the heart’s ground is swept.
Guarding the Yellow Court, revolving the primordial Dao,
in tranquil leisure, perceiving the mystery within the profound.
Riding the moment, the inch of heart steadies.
Nature at heaven’s edge, life at the sea’s bottom.
Awakened by the Bronze Mirror,
the Bronze Mirror—
formless, radiant, hard as iron.
Behold yourself, transforming heaven and earth,
gathering the sun’s essence, all obeying
the Dharma King’s decree.

**Second Watch**
Within the crucible, ten thousand lotus blossoms bloom.
The yellow sprout refined, a single drop descends from heaven.
Drawing life from death, the formless yet takes form.
Illuminating the ten directions, everywhere bright.
Behold the celestial gutter, gleaming resplendent,
herding the flock, clapping hands in laughter.
Swiftly leaping over Cloud Dream,
leaping over Cloud Dream,
treading the Spirit Terrace, crying aloud in a high voice.

Behold yourself, receiving the golden tablet,
inscribing your name, attaining realization—
the Dao of Non-Action.

**Third Watch**
Within the crucible, majestic stillness stands unmoved.
A lone pillow in slumber,
piercing the dream of millet.
The white crow arrives at dawn,
the Cavern of Supreme Clarity radiant with light.
The seas run dry,
each pearl now played in hand.
The Purple Yang Palace stands alone,
wandering idly through the Crystal Palace.
How fine the Ninth Grade’s Unborn Ground,
the Unborn Ground—
all marshaled in the Great Hall, ranks of Vajras arrayed.
Behold yourself.

The ladder to heaven—
how to know it?
Coral stone, true lapis lazuli?

**Fourth Watch**
Fiercely now, battle the Demon King.
From the Formless Palace,
wielding the Double-Tailed Sword.
Vanquishing the Demon King,
ten thousand leagues become one expanse.
Body and visage unbound,
entering the Penglai Court.
Who knows this news?
One muses, one laughs alone.
How wondrous the mystery within the profound,
the mystery within the profound—
a set of chess pieces clamoring on the board.
Behold yourself:
scholar, minister, pawn,
deploying cannons, advancing chariots and horses,
the general’s gaze fixed.

**Fifth Watch**
Just awakened, the heart opens in sudden realization.
Swiftly redouble effort,
advance another step beyond the pole’s tip.
Rushing to the Purple Yang Palace,
breaking through the Caoxi Road.
These labors—
no need to speak of them lightly.
Grasping the golden countenance, seizing the sword’s hilt,
take charge yourself, let nothing slip away.
Unleash the writhing dragons in combat,
the writhing dragons in combat—
do not let the sheep grow lean with hunger.
Behold yourself:
vigilant on the dike,
thieves do not steal.
The guard has not faltered.

leaping over Cloud Dream,

chunks.original_text: 周天候。 五更道情十二首 倒卷黄河一脉通，养来柔弱似婴童。 世人若问长生路，笑指蓬莱碧海东。 一更里，修行要仔细，休教意马走东西，走东西。 猿猴锁在方寸地，这青牛老子能骑，这青牛老子能骑。 金丹花儿勾一，宝剑插在炉里。 龙虎交，会坎离，水火颠倒成既济。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无花开叶儿落。 一更里，修行提正念，十字街前炼金丹，炼金丹。 不用水火不用炭，只要悟打坐参禅，只要悟打坐参禅。 金丹花儿勾二，黄婆引去婴儿。 上泥丸，透玄关，婴儿姹女两团圆。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无释迦牟尼佛，南无花开叶儿落。 二更里，修行要团圆，姹女婴儿在两边，在两边。 黄公黄婆为媒眷，将二家结就因缘，将二家结就因缘。 金丹花儿勾三，说起生死不难。 说不难，却又难，不在身边在那边。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无西方如来佛，南无花开叶儿落。 二更里，修行要心专，手提一根无影剑，无影剑。 六贼赶至魔王殿，将三尸斩首目前，将三尸斩首目前。 金丹花儿勾四，我今遇着明师。 与咱指，一条路，时时刻刻用功夫。

**The Circumpolar Watch**
*Twelve Daoist Songs at the Fifth Watch*

A single vein reverses the Yellow River’s flow,
nurturing softness tender as an infant child.
Should the world ask of the path to longevity,
laugh and point east—toward Penglai beyond the emerald sea.

**First Watch**
In cultivation, be meticulous,
lest the mind-steed gallop east and west, east and west.
Bind the gibbon within the square inch of the heart,
for this Old Master rides the azure ox, rides the azure ox.

The golden elixir’s blossom—first verse,
the precious sword sheathed in the furnace.
Dragon and tiger entwine, Kan and Li unite,
water and fire inverted to achieve completion.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**First Watch**
In cultivation, uphold right mindfulness,
before the crossroads forge the golden elixir, forge the golden elixir.
No need for water, fire, or charcoal,
only through awakening, seated meditation, and dhyāna, only through awakening, seated meditation, and dhyāna.

The golden elixir’s blossom—second verse,
the Yellow Dame leads the infant away.
Ascend the Mud Pill Palace,
pierce the Mysterious Pass—
infant and maiden unite as one.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Śākyamuni Buddha*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Second Watch**
In cultivation, strive for unity,
the maiden and infant at either side, at either side.
The Yellow Duke and Yellow Dame serve as matchmakers,
binding the two households in karmic ties, binding the two households in karmic ties.

The golden elixir’s blossom—third verse,
speaking of life and death is no hardship.
No hardship? Yet it is hard—
not here, but there, beyond.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Tathāgata of the Western Paradise*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Second Watch**
In cultivation, focus the heart,
grasping the shadowless sword, the shadowless sword.
Drive the six thieves to the Demon King’s hall,
behead the three corpses before your eyes, behead the three corpses before your eyes.

The golden elixir’s blossom—fourth verse,
now I have met my enlightened teacher.
He points me to one path,
a path for ceaseless practice, moment by moment.

chunks.original_text: 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无大肚弥勒佛，南无花开叶儿落。 三更里，修行要防危，休将六贼搬弄你，搬弄你。 聚气凝神总下移。 烧纸钱送将出去，烧纸钱送将出去。 金丹花儿勾五，我今得了功夫。 采先天，补后天，滚出云门天外天。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无接引准提佛，南无花开叶儿落。 三更里，修行莫漏机，黄河倒卷上天梯，上天梯。 玄关站定青牛蹄，颠倒颠取坎填离，颠倒颠取坎填离。 金丹花儿勾六，狮子炼成火猴。 我今想，去云游，翻过甲子到瀛洲。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无十八罗汉佛，南无花开叶儿落。 四更里，修行要用心，双树林中点慧灯，点慧灯。 照见世尊他去门，极乐国前等一等，极乐国前等一等。 金丹花儿勾七。 空中有人提携。 骑青牛，过玄关，炼颗金丹圆又圆。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无燃灯古老佛，南无花开叶儿落。 四更里，修行要用功，须看西南起巽风，起巽风。 水火既济颠倒用，将药火齐火炉中，将药火齐火炉中二金丹花儿勾八，婴儿姹女荣华。 主人翁，认得他，打成一片是作家。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无大鹏金翅佛，南无花开叶儿落。 五更里，修行金鸡叫，迷人不是这条道，这条道。 铁树开花蕊不少，完满了自有根梢，完满了自有根梢。 金丹花儿勾九，说起人人皆有。 说起有，却又无，说无说有永不休。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无孔雀明王佛。 南无花开叶儿落。 五更里，修行太阳红，须防火候一场空。 一场空。 霞光万道金莲涌，完满了自然成功，完满了自然成功。 金丹花儿勾十，我今来在家里。 见主人，笑嬉嬉，我问真人在那里？ 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无长耳定光佛，南无花开叶儿落。 念罢五更到天明，正东闪上小桃红，小桃红。 东生西落催人老，躲三灾报答师恩，躲三灾报答师恩。 金丹花儿勾十一，我今来在深山里。 搭一座，草茅庵，降龙伏虎自然宽。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无阿弥陀佛，南无花开叶儿落。 念罢五更一坦明，一道红光是至真。 黄龙透出三关顶，到今日跨鹤飞升，到今日跨鹤飞升。 金花十二一齐开，玉皇老子丹书来。 穿仙农，化莲台，炼就金身全不坏。 金丹花儿快乐念，念上一声佛，南无无量受福佛。 南无花开叶儿落。 九更道情九首 生我之门死我路，几个惺惺几个悟？ 夜来铁汉自思量，长生不死由人做。 一更里。 回心向善，为生死其实艰难。 自从离不古灵山，混沌初分下世间。 西万有本，丢下根原。 来在东土，性命落凡，失迷了，老母当初末生前。 二更里，成人长大，城市中立下根芽。 如饥知渴知上下，不知生死何处发！ 二房居住，不识真假。 不修出路，只顾眼下，顺六贼，坏了自己主人家。 三更里，邪淫休念，牢锁定意马心猿。 花街柳巷少贪顽，别人妻女成婚眷。 尽是破戒，尽是魔缠。 二鬼来勾，不敢倒看，入地府，那时难见如来面。 四更里，贤愚难辨，惺悟的识破机关。 看见世人不久远，百岁光阴急如箭。 及早回头，正是中年。 拜求明师，口诀相传，指与你，从前本来娘生面。 五更里，归依如来，为生死斩断恩爱。 观见世事好伤怀，恐怕惹下轮回债。

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Maitreya, the Laughing Buddha*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Third Watch**
In cultivation, guard against peril,
let not the six thieves manipulate you, manipulate you.
Gather qi, condense spirit—all descends.
Burn paper money, send them forth,
burn paper money, send them forth.

The golden elixir’s blossom—fifth verse,
now I have gained the skill.
Draw from the primordial,
mend the postnatal,
roll forth through Cloud Gate to the heavens beyond heavens.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Cundi, the Guiding Buddha*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Third Watch**
In cultivation, miss not the moment,
the Yellow River flows backward up the heavenly ladder, up the heavenly ladder.
Stand firm at the Mysterious Pass on the Green Ox’s hoof,
invert and fill Kan with Li, invert and fill Kan with Li.

The golden elixir’s blossom—sixth verse,
the lion refines into a fiery monkey.
Now I wish to wander,
crossing the *jiazi* cycle to reach Yingzhou.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Eighteen Arhats*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Fourth Watch**
In cultivation, focus the heart,
light the lamp of wisdom in the twin trees’ grove, light the lamp of wisdom.
Behold the World-Honored One’s departure,
wait before the Land of Ultimate Bliss, wait before the Land of Ultimate Bliss.

The golden elixir’s blossom—seventh verse.
Someone in the void lends a hand.
Ride the Green Ox,
pass through the Mysterious Pass,
refine a golden elixir, round and whole.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Dipamkara, the Ancient Buddha*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Fourth Watch**
In cultivation, devote your effort,
watch the southwest wind rise from Xun, rise from Xun.
Water and fire conjoin in inversion,
unite the medicine and fire in the crucible,
unite the medicine and fire in the crucible.

The golden elixir’s blossom—eighth verse,
the infant and the maiden flourish.
The master,
recognizing them,
forges them into one—this is the adept’s work.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Mahāpakkha, the Golden-Winged Buddha*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Fifth Watch**
In cultivation, the golden rooster crows,
this path misleads no one, this path.
The iron tree blooms, its pistils countless,
fulfilled, it bears its own root and stem,
fulfilled, it bears its own root and stem.

The golden elixir’s blossom—ninth verse,
speaking of it, all possess it.
Speaking of possession, yet it is absent—
to speak of absence or presence never ceases.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Mahāmāyūrī, the Peacock Wisdom King*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Fifth Watch**
In cultivation, the sun reddens,
beware lest the fire’s timing come to naught, come to naught.
Ten thousand rays of rosy light surge as golden lotuses,
fulfilled, success comes naturally,
fulfilled, success comes naturally.

The golden elixir’s blossom—tenth verse,
now I have come home.
Seeing the master,
smiling,
I ask: Where is the true person?

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Sthiramati, the Long-Eared Buddha of Steadfast Light*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

The chants of the fifth watch end as dawn breaks,
in the east glows the peach-blossom red, the peach-blossom red.
East rises, west sets—hastening age,
avoid the three disasters to repay the teacher’s kindness,
avoid the three disasters to repay the teacher’s kindness.

The golden elixir’s blossom—eleventh verse,
now I have come to the deep mountains.
Erect a thatched hut,
taming dragons and subduing tigers, at ease.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Amitābha*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

The chants of the fifth watch end in radiant clarity,
a crimson light—this is the ultimate truth.
The Yellow Dragon pierces through the three barriers’ peak,
today I mount the crane and ascend,
today I mount the crane and ascend.

The twelve golden flowers bloom as one,
the Jade Emperor’s cinnabar script arrives.
Don the immortal’s robes,
transform into a lotus dais,
refine the golden body—imperishable.

The golden elixir’s blossom—joyful chant,
chant once the Buddha’s name:
*Namo Amitāyus, the Buddha of Infinite Life*,
*Namo*, the flower blooms, its leaves fall.

**Nine Daoist Songs of the Ninth Watch**

The gate that births me is the road that kills me—
how many are wakeful? How many are enlightened?
At night, the iron man reflects alone:
long life and deathlessness are made by man.

**First Watch**
Turn the heart toward goodness,
for life and death are truly arduous.
Since parting from the ancient Vulture Peak,
the primordial chaos first divided, descending to the world.
The western ten thousand possess their root,
yet cast it aside.
Coming to the eastern land,
life and fate fall into the mundane,
lost and confused—
the original mother before birth.

**Second Watch**
Grown to adulthood,
roots planted in the city.
Hungry, one knows thirst; knowing up and down,
yet not knowing where life and death arise!
Dwelling in the second house,
unable to discern truth from falsehood.
No path of cultivation,
only attending to the present—
following the six thieves,
ruining one’s own master.

**Third Watch**
Abandon lustful thoughts,
firmly lock the intent-horse and mind-ape.
Seldom indulge in the flowery streets and willow lanes,
taking others’ wives and daughters as kin.
All is broken precepts,
all is demonic entanglement.
Two ghosts come to lure,
dare not look back—
entering hell,
then it will be hard to see the Tathāgata’s face.

**Fourth Watch**
Wisdom and folly are hard to distinguish,
the wakeful see through the mechanism.
Beholding the world’s impermanence,
a hundred years pass swift as an arrow.
Turn back early—
this is middle age.
Seek a bright teacher,
receive the oral transmission,
pointing to your original face from before your mother’s birth.

**Fifth Watch**
Take refuge in the Tathāgata,
for life and death, sever love and attachment.
Beholding worldly affairs brings sorrow,
fearing the debts of rebirth.

chunks.original_text: 心猿锁定，休教损坏。 提出正念，无边无界，趁香风，及时正好早归来。 六更里，细认本宗，将猿猴锁在房中。 若来若去莫放松，昼夜挂剑守深宫。 四门上锁，压定妖风。 看破红尘，尽是浮空，主人翁，时时常把真经诵。 七更里，要脱尘埃，多承了恩师携带。 受持三规并五戒，发下洪誓永不开。 世事皆小，生死事大。 斩断轮回，金刚不坏，滚浪里，现出一枝白莲来。 八更里，把守真铅，古弥陀倒坐玄关。 呼吸元阳上下转，前后三三一担担。 黄河倒卷，泥牛耕田。 鹊巢灌顶，地涌金莲，须弥顶，透出一道灵光现。 九更里，苦炼三家，红炉中火候不差。 无影树下现金花，性命二字两头发。 三车搬运，赵州斟茶。 去到西方，参拜佛家，小婴儿，见娘呵呵喜笑煞。 叹出家道情七首 叹出家，到也奇，看破了世路云泥。 一心不染红尘事，任凭他浮名美利，任凭他爱子娇妻。 劳形不如归山去，俺怎肯终日奔驰？ 俺怎肯终日寻思？ 修行当发冲天志，做一个慷慨男子，打破了生死机关，无烦无恼无优虑。 叹出家，到也幽，断却了妄念忧愁。 人生那得无尘垢，俺怎肯图利贪求？ 俺怎肯空自罢休？ 断然不落无常手，发洪誓去把师求，发洪誓时把真修。 自然有日丹成就，任凭我跨鹤乘舟，任凭我散步优游，真玄道妙谁参透！ 叹出家，到也深，学些儿借假修真。 行住坐卧把真心定，爱的是养气提神，喜的是木降金升。 灵光现出圆如镜，顷刻间窍窍通灵。 黄河水运转昆仑，自然认得真玄化。 叹出家，到也玄，看破了打坐参禅。 主人现出是何物件，玄中理默默无言，动静处添汞抽铅。 如痴如醉神不倦，进火时文武相煎，温养时子后午前，水火既济同烹炼。 叹出家。 到也精，准备若猛将强兵。
chunks.translated_text:
Lock the mind-ape fast—let no harm befall it.
Raise forth right mindfulness,
boundless and unbounded,
riding the fragrant breeze,
return in good time.

**Sixth Watch**
Carefully discern your root lineage,
lock the ape within the chamber.
Whether coming or going, never slacken,
day and night wield the sword to guard the deep palace.
Seal the four gates,
suppress the demonic winds.
Seeing through the red dust,
all is but emptiness.
Master,
ever recite the true scripture.

**Seventh Watch**
To cast off the dust,
great thanks to the guiding teacher.
Uphold the Three Regulations and Five Precepts,
vow resolutely never to break them.
Worldly affairs are small,
the matter of life and death is great.
Sever the wheel of rebirth,
indestructible as vajra,
amidst the surging waves,
a single white lotus appears.

**Eighth Watch**
Guard the true lead,
Ancient Amitābha sits inverted at the mysterious pass.
The primordial yang breath circulates up and down,
three before and three behind, borne as one.
The Yellow River flows backward,
the mud ox plows the field.
The magpie’s nest crowns the head,
golden lotuses rise from the earth.
Atop Mount Sumeru,
a ray of numinous light shines forth.

**Ninth Watch**
Refine the three families with bitter toil,
the furnace’s fire never errs.
Beneath the shadowless tree, golden blossoms appear,
the two words *nature* and *life* sprout from both ends.
Three carts transport,
Zhaozhou pours the tea.
Arriving in the West,
pay homage to the Buddha’s family.
The little infant,
seeing its mother, laughs with boundless joy.

**Seven Laments on the Dao of Leaving Home**

I lament leaving home—how strange it is,
seeing through the world’s path as cloud and mud.
With a heart unstained by red dust,
let fame and profit drift as they may,
let beloved children and charming wives be.
Toil of form is not worth returning to the mountains—
how could I bear to race all day?
How could I bear to scheme endlessly?
Cultivation must set a soaring resolve,
to be a bold and generous man,
shattering the mechanism of life and death,
free from vexation, sorrow, or care.

I lament leaving home—how secluded it is,
cutting off deluded thoughts and worries.
How can life be without dust or grime?
How could I seek profit or covet gain?
How could I idle and give up?
Resolutely not falling into impermanence’s grasp,
I vow to seek a teacher,
vowing to truly cultivate.
Naturally, one day the elixir will be perfected,
whether I ride a crane or sail a boat,
whether I stroll leisurely,
who has fathomed the wondrous mystery of the true Dao?

I lament leaving home—how profound it is,
learning to borrow the false to refine the true.
In walking, standing, sitting, lying, stabilize the true heart,
loving to nurture qi and uplift spirit,
delighting in wood descending and metal ascending.
The numinous light appears, round as a mirror,
in an instant, every aperture becomes spiritually attuned.
The Yellow River’s waters turn Mount Kunlun,
naturally recognizing the true mystery of transformation.

I lament leaving home—how abstruse it is,
seeing through seated meditation and Chan inquiry.
The master appears—what is this thing?
In the mystery, principle is wordlessly silent,
in movement and stillness, adding mercury and drawing lead.
Like a fool, like a drunk, the spirit never tires,
when advancing the fire, civil and martial contend,
when nurturing, after midnight and before noon,
water and fire conjoin in the same refining.

I lament leaving home—how refined it is,
preparing as a fierce general and mighty soldier.
